review_body: From the moment we walked in the door we were greeted and treated like one of the gang, the staff was very approachable which made the stay in a large unfamiliar city much more comfortable. Megan D. provided top notch service and went above and beyond our expectations! The Moxy definitely has a fun and playful vibe, I loved this combined with the modern and distinct decor all the while being impeccably clean.

I loved drinking at the bar with Brian C. The man is excellent vibes. We came for one drink and stayed for five because we were giving out. Highly recommend! Will be coming back soonP.s. Brian reminds me of Vinny Chase

I’m originally from Manhattan and had to go back recently for a weekend. As a native New Yorker, I can honestly say The Moxy’s a true steal for its location and price. It’s near everything downtown (including One World Trade and other attractions) and is only a short subway ride away from the rest of what New York City has to offer. I highly recommend it!

Excellent hotel, fab location close to Ground Zero, modern, nice clean rooms, lovely bar meeting area, good security access to lifts. Friendly helpful staff. No night noise. Subway just round the corner. Highly recomnended

My frequent stays at the Moxy only improve as I continue to return to this location. I am always provided excellent customer service, recommendations, and amenities within the room that make the experience pleasant. Any issues are always dealt with immediately and always professional. One of the many employees there Rachel and another employee there named Rich are very polite every visit and I always look forward to seeing them at the Moxy I look forward to returning soon.

Great bar area with games, good dj and solid food. The space is large and comfortable. They have solid happy hours deals. Brian C mixes one of the best spicy margaritas around. Friendly staff. A trendy gem in FIDI.

The service was kind, helpful and resourceful. The room had a smoke smell and the room did not feel clean. Would not go back to this hotel. The front desk people helped with parking, taxi and questions we had. Richard was extra helpful!!

I came to New York for a longer than normal stay. I needed a great location close to the office but also close to the action. The Moxy Downtown was perfect for both. The rooms are cool and funky and very minimal, totally my style. When I first arrived on a Thursday night there was a Dj spinning music at the bar, I got to use my free drink coin and it was on. Half way through my stay, I started to feel like I needed a little more room, I had done a lot of shopping and started to run out of room. I mentioned this to the concierge Rachel, and she helped me out. She got me into something just a little bit bigger and it made a world of difference. Thank you Rachel + Moxy NYC for making my stay magical. :)

Very functional hotel near the financial district of Manhattan. Easy walk to Broadway, The Brooklyn Bridge and the Fulton Street subway station. Close to local restaurants and stores. We stayed in room 1101 - King bed with a city view.The Moxy has a cool bar and relaxation area which is always hopping in the evenings! However, the Moxy is one of those chic, hip, no frills hotels so do not expect a refrigerator in your room or a safe or an iron. The rooms also have an interesting window hatch between the bedroom and the shower with a sliding photo that can be used to block the view...but control of the sliding photo is on the bedroom side!(Maybe a problem if you are traveling with kids ) Also, and I’m sure this is the hotels fault, but every time the air came on, you would get a faint smell of weed. The only other complain would be that the sheets felt like they were made of parchment paper and not very comfortable.

We recently stayed at the Moxy whilst on a short visit to NYC. The hotel is located in a good location and it takes less than a minute to get onto the subway. It’s also very close to Wall Street, China Town, Brooklyn Bridge and the World Trade Centre. The property was easy to find and it has a good selection of nearby stores and restaurants. The hotel staff were mostly very good. The luggage porter was excellent and was definitely the most helpful and friendly member of the team. The hotel reception is rather small, but I guess it does the job. The colleague that checked us in was very pleasant and helpful. However, we did drop by the reception on one occasion and the woman behind the desk was very unhelpful, blunt and rather rude.The decor and theme of the property was fitting and rather well done. However it’s most definitely a property for the younger crowd and millennials. The room was really rather small (but this is NYC) and it had a good view. However it did lack some of the amenities that we would have wanted at our fingertips e.g. coffee facilities, but that was most likely poor planning on our behalf. In the room the fan was either on full or auto which is rather annoying, it would be nice to be able to select a continuous low fan. The bed was comfortable however the duvet is incredibly thin, it was much more of a blanket rather than that of a duvet. We did sleep well and on the whole we found the room quiet in a busy city. You have to take two elevators to get between ground level and your room which is rather annoying and a feature of properties that we tend to dislike. It may sound trivial, but having to wait for two elevators in a busy hotel when all you need to do is quickly get to or from your room is pretty annoying. We wouldn’t stay here again but I can appreciate that it’s (Moxy) just isn’t a brand of Marriott for us. Between me and my partner we stay at Marriott hotels around 300 days per year. So we’re very loyal to the brand however this just isn’t for us. The hotel felt much more like a youth hostel than a hotel and that’s not what we wanted.

This was my first stay at Moxy and me and my girlfriend loved our stay! The recreation, basketball court, bar are truly amazing! Makes you not even want to even leave to go anywhere else for drinks. They even had a DJ! The room was comfy and truly perfect for our one night stay! I went ahead and booked my next stay for my birthday next month. Thanks so much to the staff at Moxy for an amazing experience!

First experience at Moxy. Crowd is very Gen Z/Millennial. Tough to get space for relaxation at the end of the workday in Rec area. Front desk staff went over and above after an initial mistake. Head and body shampoo isn't a good choice for female travelers. AC/Heating system in room is loud.....

The Moxy was amazing experience. but the best part of our stay was the bond we formed with the bellman Richard. he greeted us with a giant smile and a warm hello. on our last night he took us up to the top floor to get a amazing look at the Manhattan Bridge. Richard took our experience from good to great. we (a family of 4) got 2 rooms with 2 queen beds in each. that was a good move because the rooms were pretty small. overall a great trip. (Richard deserves a raise for all the good work he’s doing

Just spent three nights at this hotel on a family vacation and really enjoyed staying here. The room was comfortable. I especially liked the shower. When we arrived on Saturday, we were told our room wasn’t ready which was odd considering the time. The front desk person gave us chips for free drinks in the very nice 3rd floor lounge. We eventually got into our room around 7 p.m. Other than that glitch, all else was fine. The hotel is in a good location — very near the 9/11 memorial— with easy access to the subway.

I should have known better than to stay at a Hotel, whose recorded message starts out with Hey .. what’s up! Seriously.. rude staff. No manners. The room itself , no issues .. however everyone talks down to everyone. Very annoying. The free drink tokens are a joke and cannot be used lol .. why give them out? This hotel may work for some . Not me .Pretentious crap.

5 couples that we know all stayed here on a Saturday night. We had a great time. Everyone was very friendly and bar was hopping later on in the night . Rooms are pretty roomy for a Manhattan hotel. Not a ton to do in that area but if you want to stay downtown this is a great place to stay.

From the Check in and Check out the experience was great i was able to get lucky to find a parking outside in the front. The beautiful lady Destiny is a genius she help me pull up my employee discount when i was struggling to do so lol. Plus the Bellman i forget his name was great as well. Definitely will be back in the future.

My partner and I stayed here recently and loved it. The hotel was super accommodating and the room we had was great. We only had one small problem but we were quickly helped by a pleasant young woman named Celine. Thanks so much for the stay!

Quite close to the WallStreet and Ground Zero this hotel represents the prototype of the Mariott brand Moxy. Small rooms, clean, practical. Good mood in the lobby on 3rd floor. Personnel was mostly friendly. Some not. Unusual for the brand. Some of them seemed to work too long hour, e g at reception. Overall a good reco, not cheap though. Upper floors quiet which is key in that city to get some sleep at least.

We had our work offsite at the Moxy NYC Downtown. The staff was wonderful, rooms were great, bar was excellent (plus they have a skee-ball alley and shuffleboard table) and the meeting space was fun and functional! Highly recommend ...

We used their mixed space for a corporate event of 35 people. Open air space. Stadium style chair set up with AV set up. Excellent coffee, snacks and lunch. Separate set up for our photographer to do headshots. Event ran perfectly and people were always around to help make sure we had everything we needed. We definitely use the hotel again.

I really loved my stay when I stayed with my boyfriend. The front desk staff were so kind and caring. Rachel and another young lady checked us in and they were phenomenal!! It was my boyfriend's birthday and they did a full blown room decor. Fabulous. Will definitely be coming back!!

This is actually my 3rd time visiting this hotel and i absolutely love it!! I came for a date night with my husband, my daughters birthday & for my birthday I love the bar/ lounge area great vibes, games & food!!.the bartenders are amazing! Rachel, Celine, matt, Raulph & rich gave us the most warm welcome we felt very comfortable and right at home!! I will def come back!!

First up thanks to Loren and Celine for being great this trip. The hotel is located at a great spot, close to everything you need at any time of the day including the famous Joe's Pizza and Shake Shack burgers just within minutes. Wall St is a good 10 minutes walk away, and the room was really comfortable -- we stayed during winter. The lounge was awesome as a hang-out spot to meet others too. Will be back again! Cheers from Aussie.

I stayed here this past weekend for a business trip and needed an early check-in/late check out and Celine made that happen. Both Celine and Matt were welcoming and provided tips of places to see during my stay. I would definitely stay here again!

Came for my anniversary with my significant other and everything was beautiful. Celine gave us the absolute best treatment, from a great room and view, great amenities, to an even better room layout with rose petals and a beautiful message on the mirror. Romantic and beautiful to say the least. 10/10 will come again for her service alone. Ambiance of everything and everyone else was great, such an amazing idea with the bar, game room, and indoor gym. Had an amazing time and I can’t wait to book again!!

Trendy hotel, lively bar area. Friendly staff, Rafael was very helpful. Stayed for a week during a business trip. My colleagues enjoyed it as will. Convenient to subway (Fulton St), 24hr CVS, late night pizza joint.

We were at Moxy celebrating my friend’s birthday after work, and the service and music were impeccable. Briannia Walters was our waiter/bartender, and she was the absolute best. Kind, fun, awesome. Definitely try to get her for your next function. Will 100% be back.

Briannie literally made my experience and I would not have stayed if it wasnt for her. She was attentive and true joy to be around.She took care of a friend who was experiencing a bad time and made it her mission to ensure they would enjoy themselves. And it worked!

I've stayed at Moxy Downtown twice, I've enjoyed my stays there. Awesome location and great lobby bar on the third floor. Loren and Matt were very accommodating, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in lower Manhattan.

Moxy’s rec bar is a hidden gem in lower Manhattan. It has a modern speakeasy feel but there is an energy about this place and a lot of fun to be had here. Staff like Brian makes you want to visit again

Me and my friends love going to the bar at Moxy, delicious food - tuna tartare and chicken with waffle my favoritesand perfect cocktails - thanks to BrianAlso, there is great atmosphere and cool crowds

review_body: Stayed 3 nights the hotel is in a great area walking distance from the the mall, shops, restaurants, and Statue of Liberty viewing area. Front desk people were cool. The upstairs lobby was very neat and hip with games and a live DJ though I never ordered anything. Everything is very clean room/hotel is fairly new. The room and hallways were quiet and they smelled good. Cleaning service only came once on the last day. Though they did ask on the second day and I said yes please and to come back in 20 mins as I was changing and getting ready to leave the room however they never came back. Room I purchased was a king city view, though the king beds aren’t standard king beds they are smaller but that’s New York. The only thing that upset me was there was no chair swing in my room but it the pics of the room I booked on orbits it shows the chair swing in the king city view, it made me sad when I walked by rooms with the door open and I could see in and saw that they had a swinging chair. :/

The group we went with chose this hotel as it was in a great location for the things we needed to do, most of which were downtown. The lobby and bar were great and the rooms, especially the view was very good. This was a little younger, hipper than I usually do. Rooms were very minimalist, it made an Aloft seem like luxury. However, for as much as I use the room, it was totally sufficient. I will say the members of our party who chose this were 20 years younger than me. Still I totally enjoyed and I did like the communal floor with bar and other uses. Finally, if your business is downtown, the location was very good.

Rachel over at front desk made my experience all the more sublime. The game room, drinks and night vibe w a dope DJ made everything, everythinggggg. Will definitely return to top my last visit. Thanks Rachel and team.

Her personality is infectious,she is very customer oriented,and she is the type of employee that makes me wanna come back to the Moxy for a another stay, while in New York! The rooms are cozy and trendy, very clean. We will definitely be back for another stay soon. -Danny and EddieFrom Savannah GA

We generally really enjoyed our stay. My teenaged kids really liked the games and basketball hoop on the 3rd floor. Drink tickets were nice and the drinks were tasty. Excellent location within walking distance to a lot, including a great subway station. Despite what others said, we found the room (2 double beds) to be spacious enough for the 4 of us when suit cases were stored under the beds. Decor was nice and clean. Taking stars away for just a sheet and thin blanket on the beds (brrrrr), no turndown service one day, nobody answers the phone to help, paying for a “city view” but being on the 12th floor (hardly half way to top of building) and seeing only a few close up walls of other buildings, and most importantly, being charged ~$90 extra!!!! (White pic is my reservation, blue is the charge to my cc. We didn’t buy anything/charge anything to the room!) Can’t even get through on the phone to rectify it. I booked on the Moxy site. No paperwork given upon checkout to see individual charges. Do they put “estimated” for taxes and fees to add $$$ to bill? I don’t know. Regardless, if charges are more, they should explain and justify. I’d def stay again if I wasn’t nervous that they’d steal from me.

Beautiful hotel. The staff went out of their way to make you feel at home. Had an issue with the shades in the room and was upgraded to a bigger room with a better room. Great! Thanks to Noelle, Loren and Matt

Stayed there with my partner. From our point of view this place is perfect, it's very stylish, it offers a great view from higher floors, rooms pictures provided on various booking websites are not tweaked and you can expect the same standard, our room was spotless, the only minor drawback is the size - it could be slightly larger but for us it was not a problem. This place is a great value for your money but what makes this place unique is their staff. Celine, Lauren, Richard and above all Mat - thanks guys for making our stay such a great experience, if anyone from management reads that please take a good care of them - they are a great added value to this place.To sum up I've stayed in quite a few hotels in NYC but this one turned to be my place. I will use it again and will recommend it to everyone.

Great service, uncommon hotel, excellent location, perfect room size, they have a DJ performance at the bar area,i loved the hallways, the rooms, the deco, definitely a place to stay many times!! I hope to go back soon!

Iv loved the Moxy Brand since it started and to say this one met the standard would be a huge understatement. We arrived very early in the morning and once we got to the hotel it was nothing but comfort! Their bar area has deep sofas and board games while you wait for your room. The views from the room were amazing (see photo). We could have slept for days in those beds and the location speaks for itself! The staff were relaxed but attentive and nothing was ever too much. I would 100% recommend to a friend!

In sending my daughter off across the country to NYC unaccompanied, I thought she would have the common sense to let us (her parents) know that she arrived safely. By 10pm, she had not answered her cell phone, so I called the Moxy, and was told that there was no guest by that name. At a loss, I called back again to check if the reservation was made under the name of the company that hired her. Celine from the Moxy front desk came to the rescue after I gave sufficient information about myself. She said she recognized me as a concerned mother. (Missing person and NYC are not good thoughts in a situation like this....) She went above and beyond normal duty, to see past two errors in the reservation to confirm that my daughter had checked in - with the specific time - as well as her exit time with her friend as they had planned. All precise and descriptive information to give me immediate relief. Oh. And daughter called soon after, and was told that I got the Moxy to tear up the place trying to find her - embarrassing for her, but that's what it felt like to me, and I am grateful. Thanks a million, Celine!!! I wish any person having that type of anxiety had Celine to tell good news.

Attended the New Years Eve Party at the Moxy NYC Downtown last week to ring in the New Year with family and friends. Had a great time, the venue was decorated nicely with all accessories to celebrate the New Year in NYC Waitress was very attentive and always checking in on us to see if we needed anything. There was a DJ, appetizers and open bar. A New Years Eve to remember!!

This place was amazing! The room was so modern and super clean! Went there for New Years Eve for the party and spent the night .. the energy in the room was great from when it started until hours later after the ball dropped. The bartenders were super friendly and fast, and the ambiance really was fantastic. Breakfast the next morning was absolutely delicious and there were so many wonderful options! The location is amazing too because it’s surrounded by stores and restaurants. Amazing stay and I would absolutely stay again!!

Staying at this hotel was such a great experience. The room was clean and had such a modern feel to it. The view was amazing and the service was even better! Highly recommend! The drinks came out perfect every time and the bar tenders were extremely attentive!

the hotel and its staff made me feel that I was at a family party. the music, decorations and food were all top notch, the atmosphere was celebratory and relaxed, perfect combination. will be back next year.

Had an amazing time at the New Years Eve party! The workers were very nice and accommodating! The rooms were so beautiful and everything was very clean. Couldn’t have asked for a better time. The hotel lounge was pretty too. And the drinks were great!

The Moxys are known to pretend to be trendy. However trendy in a world class city as New York may be prone to high expectations. It might be the price or the brand but, as a general rule, one pays for a hotel to be served; not to be treated as a high school friend. Call the hotel and the message answering is a : Hey! What's up? I should have known better. How in an establishment answers wassup? Then, at check in, they address you by your first name. I've noticed it is a thing nowadays. Hi Bob. Ok Julie. That's cool Rob... But when on Earth we made this a "cool" thing? A lady 80 years old is nowadays "Marie or Gene" We all have a last name and Sir or Mam is polite enough. ... Unacceptable. Then goes the preposterous offer to not clean up the room every day. Then why pay for a hotel? Must I do my own bed? They try to sell it out under "environment care" Really? Then where's the concern when using plastic dishes,cutlery and hundreds of plastic cups? Rooms are little but fine. However they're ageing fast due to... Cleaning! Ambiance is fun but it isn't because you choose Moxy that you appreciate engaging with staff as if they were relatives. I do understand the US has a very relax attitude to social norms. Nonetheless, some deference is expected when you are the client. Chewing gum, texting behind the counter or laughing out loud about the last talk show in front of clients isn't customer service. And if you are a Marriott Bon Voy elite member just forget that you've stayed hundreds of nights to gain your status. Here in Millenial's paradise to be "elite" brings nothing. A coupon of 10U$ ro buy you a coffee, no breakfast no upgrades offered... Sorry Moxy but you've misunderstood trendiness with lousiness. Better to advertise as a "trendy" Youth Hostel than a member of the Marriott family.

Booked after I saw the nice room and location, I’m leaving desapointed. Rooms are not practical with no storage, beds are so uncomfortable (with just one pillow), the floor was damaged and on top of this, cleaning service is not done daily.

First time to New York from California so much fun staying at the Moxy. Check in line was out the door but Celine was such a doll! I had so many questions she answered them all (btw she gave me an amazing dinner recommendation for a restaurant ‘augustines’ best Italian food ever) Thank you Celine we loved it!!! Favorite place to hang out in the hotel with my bae ending up being the basketball court (sorry for spilling beer in there). Can’t wait to return !!!

I loved this hotel, from being greeted by Richard at the front door to the welcome drinks at the bar, then the room layout and the hotel's decor, I would most definently return back for another stay at the Moxy.

We recently stayed here for a long weekend in NYC & I prefer this location to midtown for a weekend visit. The hotel is 3 blocks from the 911 museum, Eataly & a few blocks from the Brooklyn Bridge (great morning walk) also Easy subway access. It was perfect for our teens as they Loved the hangout vibe of the lobby- bar+ DJ+games and an adjacent basketball court. It was nice to come back from a busy day and relax with a cocktail while the kids hung out / overall good marks for this set up. The rooms are basic and that is ok- no big desk and no closet- but clean & simple.I would not recommend the breakfast @ the hotel- average food, slow service & pricey. There is a Starbucks & Dunkin Donuts around the corner. Overall our teens thought this was the best hotel ever- they would have given it 5 stars for the fun vibe and amenities but the parents are giving it 3.

If you just want a place to stay without a lot of frills, this is it. However, be prepared for a really small room. Fine for me but could an issue if you are claustrophobic. The room is tiny but they use all the space efficiently. Lots of hooks on the wall that you can hang clothes. A small table and luggage rack are even on the wall. A nice extra touch is the steamer. Much better than an iron. First time I have had a steamer in the room so kudos for that. Nice bar and great location. Easy check in and check out. And it is a Marriott if you are collecting points. Totally recommend.

We arrived at 11 am and left our luggage, went off for the day and returned at 4pm to check in. We were given keys to a room but when we entered the room it was already occupied. It was very embarrassing. We returned to the check in desk where no one seemed to know what to do and they were more concerned that someone was in that room than trying to find us an alternative. After half an hour we couldn’t wait any longer for them to sort it as we has a dinner reservation and theatre tickets. They eventually found our luggage we took what we needed and went out. Fast forward 7 hours and we returned to the Moxy only for the self same receptionist, Celine, (at least that’s what her necklace said) to treat us as if she had never seen us before. When I asked ‘have you managed to find us a room ‘ she looked blankly, asked my name and we had to start from the beginning, she explained that she saw a lot of people in a day and didn’t remember us. Now I don’t doubt she checked in lots of people yesterday, but people who are given an occupied room and that you spend 30 minutes with would stick out in your memory, unless it happens frequently, but when I relayed the whole of what had happened she was totally oblivious to any if it. However we duly got an empty room, but I would have thought that a slight upgrade or a bottle of wine, or a complimentary drink at the bar would have been a nice thing for them to do considering the stress and inconvenience they caused us, but no, which is why they are getting this poor review. If they had offered a serious apology then my rating would have been higher to reflect their thoughtfulness, good customer service and attempts to make a horrible experience better. So the room is ok, but the fan is like a subway train approaching and the bed was made with the sheet on top of the blanket (is this a weird NY thing?) so I had to remake the bed. Celine had rattled off something about complimentary water and coffee but didn’t elaborate and we can find nothing in the room clarifying it so a trip to reception will be required to find out what this deal is. Sorry moxy but you only get one chance to make a first impression and your attempt was pretty poor. Poor enough to make me not want to stay with you again.

Moxy Downtown is the perfect hide-out for your explorations in downtown Manhattan. With view of Brooklyn bridge and an excellent buzzing bar, plus a nicely appointed Gym, it provides everything you need for a city getaway. While rooms are on the smaller side, they are functional and well appointed (though for a short stay only, as limited storage space). A good recommendation for a few nights in downtown.

I've stayed at/visited all of the moxy properties in NYC and the Moxy Downtown is the only one that represents hospitality. I booked a staycation for Christmas Eve and the front office team helped make my stay so wonderful.Celine checked me in and went out of her way to accommodate my needs. Also s/o to Noelle, Matt and Ralphy (probably spelling the names wrong here...) What a great team! My past experience with moxy was disappointing mainly because the staff were ignorant but I will sure come back for another staycation at Downtown!The only thing I could "complain" about is the hardware of the room. It wasn't perfect. The water pressure of the shower was very weak, and the water temperature was low (and I have a low threshold for hot water...) There is a reading light completely missing. What freaked me out at one point was that the screen of the thermo control FELL OFF... I was able to rewire it myself at the end.These were not major issues but i hope the hotel can work on them so the next time i stay it would be perfection!

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights at the end of Oct, early Nov.Overall it was a good stay.What was good:- Love the hotel's concept - encourages people to mingle at the common area/bar/lobby. A lot of games/entertainment for entertainment. Definitely suitable for young couples. - Check-in was quick, checkout was easy. (Rachel and Destiny helped us).- The bellboy was very friendly and helpful. When we were leaving, he helped to hail down a cab for us from Broadway, which was about 100meters. - The shower and toilet was clean when we came in. The room was tastefully decorated (even though there was no wardrobe)- TV came with built-in HBO and some other movie streaming applications, though you need to login to your own Netflix accountDownside- The room does not come with breakfast- There was one time that we had our room cleaned, but the housekeeping did not provide any replacement towels. When we called the housekeeping team to enquire, we were informed the towel delivery had not arrived for the day - and we should expect the new towels to come in only on the next morning. If they had known about the towel delivery issues earlier, they shouldn't have taken our used towels away. We were forced to go to bed without any shower since we did not have any towel to dry ourselves.

Lovely stuff and great service will definitely come again and stay here and great location convenient to the subway. I loved my stay thanks to Charles F. Hope to have the same experience once i come back. Definitely my favourite hotel in NYC.

Booked this property for a romantic getaway with my boyfriend because of the great location away from the hustle and bustle of the weekend travelers and relaxed atmosphere of the hotel brand. After checking in and enjoying the city, came back to the room to find the shades inoperable. Well that was a true bummer as maintenance had gone home for the night. I called down to the front desk to an agent named Charles who was very empathic regarding my dismay after I explained how important the weekend was for me. I was upgraded to a city view over looking the Brooklyn Bridge. Whoa impeccable view. I appreciate staff that doesn't give a generic I can't help you response when it's out there realm. The service recovery exemplified by Charles should be a standard in customer service. BTW I popped the question the next night and he said YES, so this trip will always be special to me.

Rooms are a bit small but that is literally my only complaint. The staff in each department was so amazing and friendly each day. Special thank you to the wonderful bartenders and the luggage guys helping at the door. Always smiling and ready to serve. Thank you! Highly recommend to stay here.

Really enjoyed our stay; rooms were a little small but not a deal breaker and you’re in NYC. Room was very clean, nice bathrooms and nice bedding. Location was great, 1 block from 9/11 memorial and half a block to a really good subway station, can get to any part of the city from this one station. I would recommend to friends and family.Great staff all the way around but a special thanks to Rich and Rafael for taking great care of us and giving us advice on where to go.

The only pro is the location (the reason why I gave two stars instead of one). Other than that, it's a below average hotel. The room is tiny and noisy. The shower head is leaky and has low water pressure. The hotel entrance door keeps being out-of-order (for 3 consecutive days) and people has to enter/exit behind the check-in counter. The bar is understaffed (2 people serving 30+ customers) and wait time for the order is super long. Will not come back.

This was my first time staying @ the Marriott branded hotel MOXY, from the moment we walked in to the Welcoming Drink we were already headed to a Great start. The room was Hip and Relaxing a great atmosphere all around. The front Desk staff were very Knowledgeable and Helpful with everything we needed from food to the neighborhood stores and local attractions, Charles is a Gem, he knew everything. We will always come and stay here!!!

We stayed for 2 nights during this holiday season. The service we received from start to finish was impeccable. We got there early, our room wasn't ready, so they watched over our 8 different luggage bags and shopping bags so we could then go about our day. They doormen were all wonderful upon each entering and leaving the hotel. Especially Rafael ! He went above & beyond and really made us feel welcome and cared for during our stay.Also, I always needed more blankets and pillows; the man who brought me more, never was impatient and always happy to help! The hotel itself is so cute and swanky. Such a cool place to stay for the weekend.Great job Moxy!

This hotel is good at one thing: location. Apart from that, is just an average hotel. The beds are hard as a rock, the shower barely have water pressure and overall experience feels like you are staying at night club attic.I believe this hotel is not for those working in the city, unless the location is the most important part.

Richard helped me get a black car to the airport, gave me a cocktail while I waited, and personally picked me up when the car arrived with my luggage waiting at the ready in the trunk. Excellent service!

Nice hotel in a perfect position far from the city confusion but still central.I loved the young atmosphere and the environment with people and games at night.The rooms are designed in a nice industrial style, very clean (super important for me) with a nice bathroom.Our room was very small, there wasn’t enough room to open the luggages but if you’re spending 3/4 days it’s perfect.Breakfast is a bit expensive and there is not a great choice in my opinion, this could be easily improved.Staff is not so friendly, especially at the bar/restaurant.NO ROOM SERVICE offered.Fast Wi-Fi.Overall a great experience, thank you!

Boutique feel on this well energized hotel.The staff are all warm, friendly and welcoming. They make you feel atHome.Cool design and innovative room designs and high energy bar by night, great work spot by day. Gym is solid too. And right near nobu and joes pizza what else do you need to get your NY groove on. My new go to in Manhattan.

The check-in process was smooth but can get congested in the very small area allocated. Once registered, the vibe on the third floor was all about fun, music, and letting your worries go! Bar staff were attentive, drinks were tasteful and exceeded expectations. Unfortunately, late night eats are not available, so getting delivery to the bar was seamless, but apparently not allowed. I was told to move from the bar to a table away to consume my food. Unhappily, I moved, but Cassidy, a bartender, was empathetic and tried to meet my needs appropriately. Rooms are trendy and small, but the location is perfect for a weekend getaway.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Had 2 great nights at the Moxy downtown New York and the staff were excellent too... big thanks to Richard for all his help. Too guy . Will definitely stay again. Thanks Moxy for a great experience and making our holiday so enjoyable

The service at the bar for breakfast on Sunday was horrible. Understaffed, and the bartenders there didn't care to provide service 11 am. Had to ask multiple people to take my order, asked for water multiple times (never got it), they cleared my coffee half way full that took forever to get. I wasted 1:30 hours waiting on bad service that I could of spent visiting the city. I stayed two days at the Moxy uptown before checking in here and I would recommend staying there instead.

Rooms very small, minimal service. Nothing extra, ie: something to set a suit case on in the very small room. I was told they are a minimalist. Everything was minimal, attitudes, no city or area info, etc. The most you get is one ply toilet paper and very rough tissue! The scent in the entry lobby was so strong I had to stand outside in order to breath. So if you want just a room at a med to high price this is your place. Anything other expectations or needs, find a better place. Oh and the drink prices are high and selection is minimal. You can’t even get a cup of hot water for a cup of tea in your room!

August 2019 was my third stay at The Moxy Downtown since March! Warm, welcoming staff . . . Clean rooms . . . Great location . . . Nice atmosphere on the 3rd floor with comfy couches . . . It's my favorite place to stay in the city!!!!

Living at this property was all about the experience. The night I arrived the place had a party in its lobby, and the reception Rachel was so nice to offer me a free drink ticket while I was waiting for my friend to arrive. On top of that, great room decor, very homie vibe, loved it!

Great location, friendly atmosphere and welcoming staff. The rooms are clean and modern, the bar on the 3rd floor has something for everyone, even a basketball court! Special thanks to Richard for helping us organise our transport back to JFK.

My husband and I stayed at the Moxy a couple of weeks ago. We loved the vibe of the place. Brand new, so clean and funky decor. The room is small but that isn't important to us at all. We received a coin at check-in for a free cocktail at the nice bar located on the third floor. They have skeetball, tabletop shuffle board game, gigantic connect four game, jenga etc. It was a really fun place to go to start the night as well as end it. The location of the hotel is perfect.....We will definately be back again. Special shout-out to Rachel who was so sweet and helpful to us in figuring out different places we wanted to get to. She was awesome!!!

Very clean and cute hotel in downtown nyc. Love the location of the hotel close the subway, restaurants, shopping and so much more. The hotel itself is very nice. The staff is amazing to interact with and the rates are very reasonable as well especially for a Marriott property! If I ever come back to nyc I will definitely be staying here

Great hotel with an amazing staff! A special thanks to Noelle: amazing service! And thanks for the upgrade!! I would recommend the standard checking instead of the automatic one: human contact is always better. This new hotel have all you need. It’s clean and very comfortable. As well as the location: perfect for visiting the city.The only point I would improve is an installation of a wardrobe: indeed it’s a bit challenging without it with 2 people in the room. The price for the room is reasonable for all facilities provided.The lobby and the bar are great: all you need to relax after a long day and before the night life!

The vibe at Moxy Downtown is everything and that’s all thanks to their super cool and chill atmosphere, great music on the Recreation floor, and awesome service. The check in was easy thanks to the friendly service of Richard and we also liked stopping over on the Recreation Floor before making our way to our room. The room was just what we needed for our getaway. Very modern and simplistic, but also relaxing. The Recreation floor is definitely a place to stop and have a drink or just people watch. Great location of course as well.Loved the Moxy and will be back again!

Just arrived to the hotel and so far the experience is amazing!!I came with my girlfriend to celebrate a special occasion in NYC and we are regreting that we havent chose this hotel for the last 2 nights too!I work for Marriott International and had the pleasure to visit many hotels from the company since last year ( 3x The Ritz Carlton, 2x Luxury Collection).. so far the Moxy NYC downtown impressed us the most!Rooms are clean and brand new (not that usual for NYC); views are incredible!Value for money is a 5!Thanks Enoch, Edward and the two girls at the reception that made us feel very welcome to this trendy hotel!

Keep in mind this is a concept hotel. If you want your boring layout and typical lobby check in, then this hotel is not for you. Rooms are super cute and things are tucked away on walls to make it functional.We got a room on the high floor thanks to the amazing staff that gave us an upgrade. Rooms are clean, fun, and have everything you need.We loved the 3rd floor lounge area.

Destiny Rivera and Rachel TucciaroneBy far the most hospitable, attentive and accommodating staff members I’ve encountered in my whole trip to New York. (3weeks). With all the misfortune that New York tried hitting me with at the these two ladies managed to turn my luck around and really see who I was as a person and took the time needed to help me when they did not have to what so ever. Made me feel at home and wanted as well as valued. I thank this two wonderful ladies for turning my trip from NADA TO PRADA ☺️

The Moxy NYC downtown was absolutely perfect for our family of 4! My husband, myself and our 2 teenage daughters had an amazing stay. They were very accommodating to our needs and always went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable. Rafael ran down the street in the pouring rain to get us a cab and was happy to do it for us! We will definitely be back to their amazing gem in the city. Oh yeah, the food and coffee were yummy and the games were so much fun to play!

Given the price, I got exactly what I expected to pay for. I would definitely consider myself 'selective' when it comes to hotels but a very last minute trip had me staying at Moxy as my usual spots were all booked for the night. The rooms are small, sparse, and modern. The staff is absolutely wonderful. The gym was adequate for a hotel gym. The lobby lounge/bar area looks cool. However when 7pm rolls around it turns into a scene with non hotel guests taking over and a DJ playing music. Not sure if this is always the case, but it was for my stay. Beyond that, you have to accept that you are staying in a hotel with a young crowd and if they happen to be staying in a room near yours, prepare for some rowdy laughing/yelling when they stumble back to their rooms. Would I stay here again? Yes but only if nothing else was available at a reasonable price.

review_body: I echo many of the previous reviews. I am a frequent traveler, spending over half the year in hotels around the world, including numerous trips to NYC per year and have stayed in dozens of properties in NYC. This one misses the goal in too many ways to count. By far the smallest rooms I’ve had in NYC which are already traditionally small. My upgraded city view I paid for was of the building next door, not the city at all and I paid for higher floor. They are a green property which I can appreciate but that means you don’t get basic hotel amenities like lotion? Come on... I’ve stayed at other “green” properties that can manage to figure that out. Went to the bar for a nightcap, stood there for several minutes because bar tender was too busy staring at her phone making faces then ever look up for those that want to spend money. Finally someone else came by cleaning bar and could see me getting frustrated staring at bar tender and said she would get her attention. Then I give her a card and said leave it open to which her response is “we do last call in 10min”.... ok? So how about “we are gonna call last call soon would you like me to put one More on”, but no her phone was clearly more important. Overall you can see and feel the poor leadership at this property. I’m guessing the GM is in way over their head. I will absolutely never stay here again. You couldn’t pay me to. I’m literally looking at other available hotels for the remainder of the week so I can get out of here tomorrow.

I was looking forward to our stay here. Everything I read suggested Moxy is a fun, funky place that would be a great place to stay with our grandchild. I booked a double queen room and was prepared for a very small room...NYC after all...and few amenities. After a long, laborious, disorganized check-in we finally got out room. Forget those pictures of a neat room with a swing chair...at least if you’re booking a double room. Our room was a sorta double room....actually a one and a half room. Oh, there were two double beds but one was crammed into a corner. The room was dark....ambient light but a broken, absent reading lamp with light for only one side of one bed. Okay...not horrible..Then we turned on the television. Sadly it was not working. I mean really? A hotel engineer tried to fix it...even brought in a new television. Still nothing. Finally we were given a new room. So we packed up and moved out. Our new room was great in comparison. Two beds with access from both sides and 3 working reading lights and voila....the much publicized hanging chair. Our grandchild was delighted...and so were we. By this time it was late...past bedtime for our grandchild...and we got ready for bed. Oh....no top sheets or blankets....just a bottom sheet on each bed. Pretty incredible. Here’s the bottom line: this hotel is clean and its employees are very nice. But, it’s a poorly managed facility with an embarrassing lack of focus and follow up. We made many calls or the front desk and were promised follow-up...most of which ever happened. All and all this is the worst run hotel we’ve ever stayed in....except for one person. Eddy, the assistant front end manager, is the only reason I’m not rating this hotel

Great hotel for a good price. Newly redesigned modern rooms. Bar and seating area were great. Would definitely stay here again. Staff is very accomodating and attentive to your every need. Food and drinks were great.

Hotel itself is overall great...especially for the price. First time here and my room was great, clean, and nicely decorated (updated, hip, modern design with some great added features that you won't find anywhere else). So why the low rating??? They offer a free drink at check in so I went to the bar shortly after checking in (around 4 PM) and was one of 4-5 ppl at the bar at that time...took almost ten minutes for the bartender to come by and of course the free drinks are mostly undesirable (for example, only one beer choice and it's Miller High LIfe...really? That's the best you can do beer-wise??? Okay, whatever it's free...can overlook that for the most part. HOWEVER, not once after that did the bartender or any of the other two bar workers come by and ask if I wanted another drink. Interesting considering it wasn't busy at all and you'd think the reason they offer a free drink is to encourage you to go there and order more in the first place!!! Well, I grew tired of waiting after >30 minutes and ended up going around the corner to another bar where the service was better. Came back to Moxy hotel bar around 6 PM to grab one last drink since their Happy Hour is 5-8 PM. I sat down near the bar itself and after 15-20 minutes I had to literally flag down a server just to place an order. Granted by this time it was getting busy but there were also more workers (2-3 bartenders and several servers working the floor). There was a couple sitting next to me who ordered 5-10 minutes AFTER me yet they got their drinks ten minutes before mine came! How is that? I notice sitting next to me on the other side is a woman who seemed to be part of the management since I noticed several workers coming to her with questions, etc. so I asked if she was part of the bar management--she said she is the director of food and beverage there. As a result, I explained to her that the service was lackluster and left a lot to be desired. I mentioned that last time I came through NY I stayed at the W and their bar service was spot on, as a point of comparison. I'm a Marriott Elite member so I have visited many Marriott properties in addition to many bars in general and the service at this bar ranks among the worst I've experienced. Moreover, all the director of food and beverage had to offer was excuses (new staff, not properly trained, short staffed overall, blah, blah, blah)...NOT ONCE DID SHE OFFER ANY RESOLUTION OPTIONS OR ASK FOR SUGGESTIONS, offer to comp my drink, offer to escalate the complaint, etc, etc. Instead she simply went back to working on her laptop and texting on her phone and completely ignored me the rest of the time I remained there. Unbelievable! I'm a business owner myself and if one of my manager-position employees was this inept at handling customer complaints/issues I would most likely replace them. The fact is, the reason the service sucks so much at the bar is because she obviously sucks at training and sucks at doing her job in the first place. Hence, I cannot fully blame the workers. Won't be back here though, that much I do know. Plenty of other venues that appreciate their customers and offer superior customer service accordingly.

This hotel is an oasis of brightness and action in an otherwise dark and lonely street. Great atmosphere, clean and comfy rooms, nice views. Love the furnishings but wish there had been a desk to work on.

review_body: I love everything about this brand! But what captures my attention is the outstanding customer service of Rafael! He helped everyone with passion, care and genuinely. From check-in to check-out he was there to help me And everyone else. I see his heart on what he do. His smile is one of his greatest asset. He makes my trip to JFK much conveniently by offering a taxi and helped me and my mother with our luggages. Everytime he sees a guest he opens the door for them and even ‘pressing’ the button of the elevator. A simple gesture that gives a great impact to customer service. I can’t wait to go back in New York and stay in this hotel again. This is my TOP priority hotel when looking for a hotel in NYC. And please give my two thumbs-up to Rafael! I appreciate everything he do!

My husband and I recently spent a long weekend at the Moxy downtown and had the BEST time. The hotel is beautiful, the service was great, the room was very clean and had such cute details (we loved the hanging chair and the barn door to the bathroom), the location is perfect (walking distance to so much shopping and great restaurants) - I could go on and on. We will definitely be back!!

The moxy is an excellent hotel to stay at, all employees are friendly and accommodating. Deva and Brianna are excellent bartenders with amazing attitudes and performance. Q is an excellent hotel engineer ready to attend to any problem big or small. Marc is a perfect lobby attendant, welcoming all guests and providing extra service at the drop of a dime. My stay was exceptional and I would highly recommend the moxy downtown to anyone wanting to visit Manhattan

The hotel has an amazing vibe and great energy. It was fantastic for the teens, young adults and parents alike (and yes we were traveling with all 3 age groups). The rooms were nicely appointed and very comfortable. But the part that made it so fabulous was the staff! Everyone we encountered were friendly and helpful, but Rafael was over top and beyond exceptional with his customer service. He was our "Go-To" guy for suggestions and assistance. We had a small hiccup with housekeeping during our stay and Enoch was amazing and so professional in getting it resolved for us. Our son goes to college in NY and the Moxy will be our new location of choice to stay when we are in the city. Thank you to all of the staff at the Moxy for making our visit so seemless and enjoyable! Cheers!

Room was clean, well designed, and perfect for our stay! No frills, but exactly what we needed! Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. There was a room ready early for us and before leaving, we were able to leave our luggage at the concierge. The bar/lounge was a great amenity. The food and drinks were delicious and prompt. The lounge was awesome and always utilized!

As a photographer, I love staying in the Financial District, and I have stayed in other hotels nearby. I love being immersed in this beautiful, historic section of downtown with all the old architecture and cobblestone streets. There are so many views and angles here to photograph, and the Brooklyn Bridge is a short walk, or an even shorter subway or Lyft ride over to the skyline views at Brooklyn Bridge Park. These are the reasons I love this location. As for the The Moxy, it is now my hands-down favorite and top choice hotel in the Financial District! Our room was so adorable and comfortable, modern, sleek – all the nice things. Of course the rooms are small, but so is every single hotel room I've ever stayed in in NYC. The biggest perk of staying here didn't dawn on me until after we moved out of the Moxy and into another hotel in Midtown. We really missed the warm atmosphere of the Moxy Lounge, where we spent a lot of time during our stay due to lots of rain and bad weather. We also travel with our small dog, and we felt comfortable and welcome in the lounge. No one ever gave us the stink-eye, or asked us to leave when we had our pug with us in the morning over coffee, or in the evening during the cocktail hour. The lounge was so comfortable and the vibe was very welcoming and relaxed, and we really missed that once we moved on to a more cold and sterile environment in Midtown. While that Midtown hotel we moved to was nice, we felt trapped in our tiny room during the bad weather, with nowhere to hang out and relax (with or without or dog), and we wished had just booked out entire trip at the Moxy. Will definitely stay here again, it was awesome!

I will be honest I had a complimentary voucher and needed a hotel that was covered by the voucher and the Moxy fitted the bill .However, what a pleasant surprise, we found a lovely modern and minimalist hotel.The staff were lovely from the moment we arrived, the room small - which is why I said ‘for a short visit ‘ - but functional yet innovative .The bar of the hotel was so buzzy and then they provide games facilities if you are minded - we weren’t as we were too jet lagged .There are a zillion restaurants close by - this was a great find and as long as they ensure their staff remain friendly and helpful and the hotel maintained to a high standard , they will have a winner here.One of their doormen went out in the pouring rain to find us a cab big enough to accommodate our luggage when we departed - it took him a while but he came back in the taxi himself to make sure we got picked up .Class service !!

This hotel is one of my favorite places to stay in NYC. One block from the Fulton Street Subway to get uptown, but right near Broadway and Vessy so its close to fun downtown. Staff all knows my name, has amazing attention to detail. The hiring here was intentionally diverse which meant a lot to me to feel valued. Hotel also very LGBTQ+ friendly, my friends visiting the hotel were all treated really like guests. Plus neat to see how they have the place decorated for each holiday. The bear in the lobby changes with the seasons, photo attached!

review_body: Let’s put this out their first...the rooms are small, however, a big however, this hotel makes up fir that in great public space and efficiently in the room.The check in area is small but no one was there when we arrived at 10:45 am. We were pleasant,y surprised to find out our room was ready. I am gold level Bonvoy and I was given two free drink tokens.From the lobby you take an elevator up to the third floor where the recreation room was located. It is a large brightly decorated space with chess tables, connect 4, and other games. The lobby does get a bit overwhelming at night ( or fun, depending on your point of view). From the lobby you go to a different elevator to get to your room. You need your room key out to tap to get to your floor.The hallways had cute decorations. Our room reminded us of the tiny house movement. Lots of clever uses of space. I called down to inquiry about the location of an ice machine and a bucket of ice was quickly brought to our door.The staff were all very friendly. At breakfast, there seemed to be only one person working which did cause it to be slow. There is free coffee and tea before 9:30 amThe location of the hotel is great. The Fulton station is around the corner, the Oculus a block away, plus City Hall/ Brooklyn Bridge and Courtland stations were both a short walk away.

This was my second time in NYC and it was EVERYTHING! My Check-in was super easy thanks to Charles! He was very sweet and made sure I got everything I needed and answered any questions that I had. The whole staff, all in all, is A-MAZING and so unbelievably courteous. The beds are very VERY comfortable that you don't want to get out. The views are beautiful, and the location is perfect. Food and public transportation are just a few steps away!

be prepared to be blown away by the incredible customer service, this new concept is fabulous. But let me just say as a frequent traveler the staff here is truly remarkable and a definite stand out.. As i arrived i was greeted and immediately accomodated by Richard, he was so helpful, knowledgable, and kind. Destiny at the front desk is a stand out when it comes to her ability to go above and beyond expectations. if your luck enough to stay when she's at the front, best assure your stay will be unbelievable.

Aside from the convenience and location. This new concept is phenomenal. However, the thing that will set this hotel apart is the INCREDIBLE, AND I MEAN INCREDIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. Destiny at the front desk not only was friendly but accomodating but she went above and beyond to ensure my stay would exceed my expectations. As a person who basically lives in and out of hotels for work, i can say Destiny will make you question all of your hotel choices from now on. you won't regret booking.

A lovely hotel that has a very unique indoor basketball court, a buzzing bar (luckily we had a room on a high floor or you might get some bar noise) The room are exceptionally clean with great lighting options and a swing chair. The shower was honestly the best I’ve had in any hotel. Downside? Not many but no fridge or coffee making facilities would be one. I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel is very clean located in Downtown New York. Rooms are small but very nice. Restaurant located on the 3rd floor where there is a bar and night entertainment. Hotel is located to ground zero, walking distance to World Trade Center as well. Staying in this hotel you can shop and go for sightseeing in Downtown, also go a cross Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan Bridge. Small check in space.

Excellent hip atmosphere, great staff, delicious food, trendy rooms and lobby... the front desk was super friendly especially Rachel L . She has been very considerate and helpful. The avokado tost for breakfast is delicious. The rooms are very modern and nicely decorated. I had a great time and will definitely come back to stay!

First you get greeted by a friendly, efficient and engaging reception team who couldn’t have been more welcoming on a busy Halloween Friday night Then you get Richard and his concierge team who made sure I was well taken care of on transport and guidance for drinks and food.I was very impressed by my first Moxy NYC Downtown experience. In general, the design is tight and sometimes playful but always with a very close eye on a good aesthetic and relevant function. Both delivering quality in a very good location for zipping uptown or into Brooklyn and all at a very crisp price. I paid double for pretty much the same in TriBeCa earlier that week.The vibe is young and vibrant in the bar restaurant which energised a weary solo traveller. In my King room I liked the lighting settings and well thought through flow, spacial assignments of storage and bathroom and in-room essentials. I chatted to a guest in the lift that said it was small but a good example of small living. She was American. I’m European and to me, it’s less a good example of efficient use of space without waste and more a example of intelligent design that is aspirational. Not a compromise, rather, an ideal.It’s hands down good value but without feeling like you’ve been cheap at all.

It is no secret that the Moxy is my favorite hotel when I travel for business. I have stayed in the Moxy across the country. The Moxy's are very consistent , however this Moxy seemed a bit cooler than the other ones . The bar scene was very busy at night, it took me a bit by surprise. Also if you want variety , you can walk around the corner and party at the bar at the Beekman . Great hotel , as always.

We had an amazing time staying at the Moxy! We even decided to stay an extra night. The bar and amenities are amazing!!! Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. Specifically Rafael who was especially nice to us and gave an incredible service when helping us out! Glad to know there’s still genuine people out there!!!!

Rafael who was the doorman at the hotel was awesome! He was always super kind and attentive every time my sister and I would go out of the hotel. He also tried to make conversation which I appreciate. I don't remember everyone's names but everyone was super open and kind (and cool). The room was beautiful. Thank you to the Front Desk for the early check-in and high floor. Working at a hotel myself, I know how hard it can be to accommodate both these factors. Loved my stay and would definitely be back!

I checked in with Destiny and she was amazing!! Somehow my reservation went to a different location and she helped me sort it all out. She was so personable and nice. Seriously the best check in I have had this year!

Really great place to stay and enjoy the City that never sleeps but keeps dreaming. Staying at the Moxy Down Town is the finishing touch and a joy for ever. Making lovely memories here. Very Nice view from hotel room.

Marriott Platinum Elite and United 1K+Million Miler here...If you stay among the suite of properties Marriott offers, you understand in advance what a Moxy property offers a business traveler. Those who complain about it vs a JW or standard Marriott simply aren’t paying attention. Moxy is a great property if you’re looking for something unique, and fits the local culture of the city that you’re staying in. It is not going to have a super large executive lounge, or business center with 20 computers and printers waiting at your beck and call. But it will offer is a great funky, local, flair, and in my experience in several Moxy properties, amazing customer service.I finished my evening and saw the empty basketball court here at the property and started taking shots. Nobody was nearby by, but quickly one of the staff came and started shooting hoops with me, even though he didn’t have to. We stayed in shot hoops for five minutes, it was really fun and reminded me of my high school days. He didn’t have to do that but he did. This is the kind of little extra effort that goes along way in my eyes.Good on you Moxy!

Very accommodating. Rafael went way out of his way to jail is a cab and then rode it back to the hotel so we could ride in it. Very nice people! The hotel has cool vibes. Although we did not personally go to the bar it looked very bumpin!

I normally write pretty positive reviews, but I had to let everyone know of my experience at the Moxy NYC Downtown from September 28 to October 5, 2019. I have never stayed at a Moxy before, but from the street my first impression of the hotel was very positive. The check-in station on the main level was a little small and could only handle one check-in at a time. Luckily, we were checking in after midnight so it was not too busy. Since I am a Gold Elite Marriott Bonvoy member, I had asked about getting a room on a high floor as I initially requested in my reservation. There were four of us in my party, so we had reserved a room with two queen beds. I was told that the two queen bedded rooms were only on the lower floors and I knew that was a lie, but it was too late for me to argue. They assigned us a room on the 6th floor out of 29. You then have to take an elevator to the 3rd floor and go through the lounge to access the room elevators. You need to use your room keys to access these elevators get to your room floor. We had several occasions during our stay where we had to go all the way back downstairs to have our keys re-activated. Another issue was trying to get my mobile key to activate. I can’t count the times I tried, but after the last time I gave up. I could never get the elevator to acknowledge my mobile key. It would work on the room door, but not in the elevator. When we arrived at our room, we freshened up quickly so we could get a late-night bite out. Our sink was draining very slowly and we alerted the front desk when we went out to eat. We knew that it would not get fixed that evening, but they told us that it would be taken care of in the morning. When we left for breakfast we inquired again at the front desk about our sink and they said they knew nothing about it, but it would be fixed while we were out. When we came back in the afternoon it was still not fixed. They said it was on the maintenance list. Again after we came back from dinner we inquired at the front desk before we went up to the room and the manager, Enoch, said that maintenance had been up there but was unable to fix the sink and they would be returning to fix it shortly. In the meantime before we headed up to the room, I displayed my frustration with Enoch and asked about moving to a room on a higher floor as I had initially requested if they could not fix our sink. He told me that those rooms on the higher floors were in “high demand”, but he would see about moving us if they could not fix the sink. I then confirmed with him that there were two queen bedded rooms on the higher floors. When we arrived at our room the maintenance technician had just arrived as well. I asked him about trying to fix the sink earlier and he told us that this was the first time he had been told about our issue and it was the first time that he came up to our room. This was another lie from the front desk. As it turned out, he was able to fix our sink and we had no additional issues with it during our stay. I had requested extra towels and pillows in the Marriott App prior to our arrival, but the request went unanswered. We called and asked for four extra pillows and two extra set of towels. The attendant came after some time and brought two towels and only one pillow. We asked for three additional pillows, but the attendant never came back so we went to bed. Five out of the seven days that we stayed we had problems getting four sets of towels since there were four of us staying in the room. On two different days they actually gave us four bath towels (I’m not sure how that happened), but we never got four of everything without asking and waiting. There was one day where we finally got four washcloths delivered just as we were leaving for the day, but we didn’t have a chance to use them and they were all clean and folded on the shelf above the toilet and when we returned from dinner, they had all been taken. I’m not sure what is going on with housekeeping at this hotel. Do they not know how many people are registered in the room? There were no complaints about the room itself. We knew it would be small and there would be limited storage, but at least it would have been nice if each bed had two drawers underneath. They only had one each. And they only gave us three hangers??? We made do though and lived mainly out of our suitcases. The oversized shower was very nice. The “living room” was nice and we played skee ball on several nights. That was lots of fun. The hours that the living room bar were open were quite sporadic. I can understand if there is no one there and they want to close early, but on two occasions there were many people still there and we were told that the bar was closed. They do not have a business center or even a computer that you can use to access the Internet and print a page out. I found that out at the front desk. At about 7:30 one morning I asked if I could somehow print an email that I needed, but their printer was apparently broken. They said the only thing I could do was wait for their administrative office to open at 8:30. Luckily there is a Staples store nearby and I was able to do that there, but it took me at least fifteen extra minutes of my time that I did not have. The customer service at the front desk leaves a lot to be desired. In my opinion they need much more training on handling issues and the ones that we had were simple ones. This is not a cheap hotel to stay at and I have had better customer service at Fairfield Inns. The location of the hotel is excellent. It’s just a few blocks from the World Trade Center and close to several subway stations. There is an urgent care behind the hotel (that we had to use and it was excellent) as well as two Starbucks nearby and it’s close to many eating establishments. Overall our stay was just average and very disappointing. Had it not been for the lack of communication with housekeeping and maintenance and the spotty customer service at the front desk, we would have rated this hotel very good to excellent as the hotel itself is very unique.

What can I say? Richard was everything. He took such great care of my mother and I. He was so polite, respectful, sweet, and helpful. Having trouble with Uber? He helped! Need to find a little store with some goodies? He helped! Favorite places to eat? He helped. Mom and I loved him so much we wanted to take him home, lol. The hotel was also beautiful and great size bathrooms. A very cool bar and helpful staff all the way around. I would definitely stay there again.

We stayed at the Moxy for two nights and loved our room. The view was amazing, the interior design fabulous, and the service incredible. Richard and Rafael were so helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean, very cozy and eccentric, high tech A/C and lighting adjustments and had some small touches that made it very special. Very quiet location, but just a short walk away from the Brooklyn Bridge and the World Trade Center. The bar inside the hotel is also so fun and is a great place to hangout with friends and family.

I just stayed at the Moxy and what made my stay amazing was the excellent customer and friendliness of the staff! One really helpful staff member was Rafael, he was already to help with a smile and no request was to much. Thanks for making my stay lovely

We had such an amazing time here, really one of our best stays! Everything is so well done, the room view, the food, coffee, location and not to mention the friendly staff specially Richard! We can’t wait to come back already ♥️

Brilliant location for downtown (way more interesting than midtown) and right on Fulton St station, which is ace for getting to anywhere on the metro. Rooms are small but really nicely done and perfect for a few days away and/or if you're a light packer. If you're the type that insists on taking a huge suitcase, don't think twice about booking the Moxy, but do think twice about why you need so much stuff (tip - you don't!).I did get grumpy on our first night when we couldn't turn the lights off or put the blinds down but maintenance got it sorted fairly quickly and we were allocated another room as well (me being an impatient Yorkshireman first asked for maintenance and 10 minutes later when maintenance hadn't appeared I went back to ask for another room (which I got) only to get back upstairs to find maintenance sorting the problem. (Tip - wife to me - have a bit more patience FFS!)Tip - to fellow travelers - make sure the electrics work on arrival and save the pain of trying to do it when you just want your bed. Apparently it happens a lot when cleaners unplug stuff they shouldn't. (Sure there's a tip in there for the hotel as well - label plugs!!)Bar is a really nice place to be. Shame that only 1 of the 3 offered draft beers was available (no such thing as going to change the barrel in the US??). Bar food snacks were nice.Gym is well appointed and way better than the exercise machine in a cupboard that normally passes as a hotel gym.Free coffee up to 9.30am a nice touch as well.

Very trendy boutique hotel tucked away off Broadway in the financial district. Small but well furnished and comfortable rooms and a great, busy bar. Special shout out to Noelle and Ralph for some great customer service. Well worth a visit for a quick trip to New York.

This is the best hotel for the money in New York City. The rooms are smartly designed and if some folks may think they're on the smaller side, with floor to ceiling windows, everything here feels big, everything here feels luxurious (they even get the towels right). From Enoch to Giovanni, the staff is truly amazing.

review_body: My recent stay at Moxy Downtown was wonderful. I spend a lot of time in hotel rooms as I travel from city to city as a speaker at shows. Moxy's unique experience is both nostalgic and chic. I'll go out of my way to stay with Moxy again.

There was confusion when I wanted to check in withs several employees milling about having a good time amongst themselves. When I got someone's attention, my status was not recognized and I had to ask for an upgrade. The room was tiny with no closet, no dresser, no desk, and no safe deposit box in the room. My colleague had a room with a view of the room directly across, which makes the experience even more claustrophobic. You get no water either (even as a premium member) or other amenity. Basically you get a bed with a nightstand and a small bathroom. For the price, there are much better alternatives in the area.
