review_body: Recently my husband and I traveled to New York (NY). It was my husband's first time in NY. When we checked into the Moxy, the hotel associate who checked us in was Yasmin. She was very friendly, outgoing and offered several suggestions on what to do and where to eat. She said that she wanted our stay to be memorable so she ensured that we had an outstanding room with an excellent view. We had a blast in New York and Yasmin ensured that we started our trip on the right track.

I’m a native New Yorker and stopped by your hotel to check on some family visiting from Texas and their stay. Updated my arrival I had some trouble locating their room. The front desk was extremely helpful and directed my to the 3rd floor through the Recreation space. To my surprise, I stumbled upon an event mixer and I’m glad it happened. There were so many interesting people there amazing conversation, great drinks and really cute bites. I really enjoyed the 4 cheese flat bread and your server Laura was absolutely pleasant sweet & quite charming. The basketball area was awesome and extremely fun. These type of events are a great way of networking in the downtown area where people can meet, exchange ideas, share a great time and I’m looking forward to coming back very soon and I’m definitely bringing some friends along. Although I’m recovering from the night I had to write to you guys and say job well done Moxy!

Be careful with your credit card for incidentals here. Someone tried to use mine for over $2900 at Rite Aid down the street after I left. Other than that, location was great. Tiny room didn’t matter. The bar area is a cool place to hangout

Really painful elevators. Just way too noisy for me. DO NOT like NOT having a desk to work on in my room. Just too tight a room for my comfort, Much prefer a traditional comfort 4 star experience . Hip hop for the 24s

Stayed at this place for 5 nights. Our rooms were sparkling clean and fresh. Housekeeping service was great, they change bed sheets and towels every day. Location is extremely good, after couple of minutes walking you can reach to many attractions and the metro is near too. The room is tiny but well equipped. (USB port, smart TV, wifi etc). Everything is clear and fresh. The lounge is friendly, and spacious. Easy check in and flawless check out. Wonderful location. I highly recommend this hotel to all types of travelers.

great location and super service, but too pricy for the size of the room and lack of amenities. Expected a microwave, fridge, and jacuzzi, but they did not have any of these! The service made up for it though! Front desk attendants were helpful and friendly. A perfect hotel for young people, and those young-at-heart!

Stayed at this place for three nights with family friends. Our rooms were sparkling clean, fresh and spacious. Housekeeping service was great, they changes bed sheets and towels every day. Easy check in and flawless check out. Wonderful location. I highly recommend this hotel to all types of travelers.

Great hotel. Excellent room service. Very clean and comfortable room. Every staff member we came across had a smile and was very helpful and friendly. Everything from entering the hotel until leaving was great. Highly recommended.

The hotel has s great location in a pleasant but busy area 3 or 4 mins walk from ground zero. Small lobby off the street and then a short lift to the bar. The bar is great but bar prices are sky high (but so is everything in this neighbourhood).You then get a lift to your room from the bar.The rooms are very small but it is New York. Staff are great but here are my issues.1. Room noise facing the street was unbelievable. So got a room move. This was arranged easily but executed poorly.2. The lifts are busy, especially in the morning. Allow 10 mins to get down.3. Lift key cards temperamental and only allow access to your floor so tricky in a group (use the stairs)4. Not a single vegan item in the hotel. Odd for somewhere trying to be cool.On the whole it's ok but do not expect to be wowed.

I had posted a 1 star rating due to poor customer service from a double-booking mixup, but Jeff at the Moxy was kind enough to call me and make things right. I look forward to staying at the Moxy sometime soon!

Location is extremly good, after couple of minutes walking you can reach 911 Memorial, Wall street etc and the metro is near too. The room is tiny but well equiped. (USB port, smart TV, wifi etc). Everything is clear and fresh. What i really missed is a closet, but it has no place to have. The lounge is friendly, and spacious. Good place to work (USB port, and electricity has been built in the table), but you can chill to.

Best for its location as its just walking distance to Wall Street, 911 Memorial, One World Trade Center, Subways, and several grocery stores. The room setup is smart design furniture which is typical nowadays in NYC due to lack of space and average room size getting smaller. Our room on 8th floor was super clean as if we were the first guests staying there, however smaller than expected. Though it had all the needed facilities one can expect from a budget hotel in a prime location except for the coffee maker! The queen bed was one of the smallest I have seen with only 2 Pillows.The staff at the front desk was very hospitable and first introduced herself before explaining all the booking details including the incidental charges authorization.The check-in and check-out experience was seamless. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

What I liked about the Moxy downtown:• Clean room, bigger than many in this price range (though still on the small side).• Well appointed room, sleek and sexy.• Bigger bathroom than most. In fact, a great bathroom.• Quiet. Virtually no street noise from my room (13th floor)• Multiple lighting options in both bedroom and bathroom -- from ambient to bright.• Attentive, pleasant staff (Especially Stephanie and Rafael)• Incredible locationWhat I didn't like about the Moxy downtown:• The noxious, subway-like stench in the tiny check-in area you have to walk through before heading up to your room -- which, oddly, happened only at night (probably because in the two nights I was there, a sewage vacuum truck was right outside on the street, doing God-knows-what. Happily, though, that odor went away the moment I entered the first elevator on my way upstairs.• No safe in my room.• No dresser or closet in my room. Just a few hooks on a wall and small, retractable table to place your suitcase on.• The ear-splitting, horrible DJ music blasting on the third floor both nights I was there. Not a huge distraction though, as that noise was completely inaudible as I went up to my room. Just a minor, have-to-pass-by-it annoyance to get to the second set of elevators that lead to the guest rooms.

The staff were amazing at this hotel even though I bothered them several times a day about travel adaptors, hotel amenities, General room issues (I couldn’t get the tv to work), housing keeping requests etc. If they could not help me they offered to help me find a solution about even where to find a grocery store or the like. This hotel rooms are small (although I am accustomed to large Australian rooms) the room was super clean, stylish and I loved all the little features like the old style telephone, beats audio through the tv. Make up mirror light. Muk products. I loved this hotel and service so much I booked to stay at the Times Square one a week later. Thanks so much for a great stay!

Organization for checking in and out was disappointing. Disorganized booking system. The hotel did not have the booking confirmation I made through Booking.com even though I had received a confirmation by email. Staff was accommodating but the whole process took a long time and I had to be on the phone with Booking.com. Ended up missing a major train ride due to the process. I'm also a Marriott Rewards member and was told upon arrival the first night that they lost my preferred customer room as it was given to someone else. Had to wait over 1.5 hours at around 6PM (promised guaranteed check in time 3PM) to just get a regular room, low floor, no view, no perks of rewards membership. They didn't make up the room or service at all during this 2 night stay.

What an amazing hotel. Staff is so friendly. If you’re in the area - the flatbreads OMGZ amazing. The basketball room on the floor with the bar is a ton of fun. There is also skeeball! Definitely coming again soon. What a great fun vibe.

This is my first time stay @ Moxy NYC Downtownme and my son spend spring brake April 18th-21st, we love the location easy to get around Manhattan,GREAT SHOPPING@21 century Store,Nice Bar for great cocktail and music.Friendly staff so helpful with big smile,special Thank you to Miss Yasmin at the front for the King room with View.also my 15 years old son love the B S ball court.we will go back and stay there again.akom joe wilailuck

Came here for a long weekend celebrating my birthday (and, as it turned out, my engagement). I'm Gold Elite with Marriott, but unfortunately, there were no upgrades available when we checked in. All good, the staff was very kind every time we spoke. We used the drink chips they gave us at check-in on our last night. My prosecco was covered; my fiancé's cider was not. The games were fun. We came in after dinner on Friday night and the DJ was blasting Backstreet Boys. I loved it, my fiancé said in the elevator, "I am officially too old for this hotel."Room is small, but I knew what we were signing up for. I LOVED the media system on the TV and how you can either manually sign out of all your services or you'll be signed out at checkout. I mean, loved. I could connect my Spotify to the TV via Bluetooth, watch my Hulu, Netflix, all of it. Well done, Moxy.Loved the location. Easy to catch the subway to everything. There was a Shake Shack just around the corner, along with a Zara. Ubers and Lyfts had a pretty hard time finding us because their GPS kept wanting to drop us off on the opposite side of the block from the hotel entrance (there's only one, on Ann St., but GPS wanted to drop us off on Fulton St.), but I figured out the best way to direct drivers by the 3rd or 4th pickup. It was COOOOLD and windy, but that's to be expected in early February. Loved Brookfield Place a few blocks away!The shower had fine water pressure. Water didn't get nearly hot enough for me, but I also take boiling lava-temperature showers, so few hotels meet this standard. Didn't mind the hooks instead of a closet, was just kind of tough to find places to set our luggage that wasn't the floor. Loved the cool cage chair. Would have liked a nightstand on both sides of the bed, there was only one. I took that one so I could use my CPAP machine.I was so excited to listen to the bedtime stories, but our phone did not work! Couldn't even reach the front desk. Totally dead. But it was never pressing enough to mention to the front desk once we got down there.All in all, my criticisms wouldn't keep me from staying there again if the price was right. Had a wonderful time and probably will stay there again next time I'm in NYC.

Besides a great location Downtown, it was perfect for my kids and I. It was nice that I was able to sit in the lobby with a drink listening to the DJ after a long day walking the city while my kids had a great time playing all of the old school games they had to offer. I will definitely be coming g back!

We loved staying at the Moxy NYC Downtown! It's in a great location in the Financial District and within walking distance to many amazing lower Manhattan sites. The hotel is clean and modern - perfect for our 2 teenage daughters who we had with us. The staff is very helpful and friendly, they held our luggage when we arrived early in the morning of our first day and on our last day too, always there to answer our questions and open the door for us (thank you Rafael!). Our room was small, but that is what you get in NYC, and we had 2 queen beds which is a rare find. The beds were comfortable and the room and bathroom were clean. We stayed on the 28th floor and had amazing views of the city. The Fulton subway station is right around the corner and can take you almost anywhere you want to go in the city. We rode the subway in from JFK and it was easy. There is a CVS right around the corner which was super convenient. We always felt safe. We would highly recommend this hotel!

This was our first time to stay at a Moxy property. Though we are older than the average consumer at MOXY, we had a delightful time. We liked the concept of the "lobby/bar" with many activities. The rooms were very small, but efficient. (And, when in NYC, not much time is spent in the hotel!). The hotel was clean and comfortable and in a safe area. We don't normally stay in the FIDI, but this time it was convenient to our plans. It is very near a subway station, so even if you will be uptown, it is a good location.If you've not stayed at a Moxy, please note that space is well-appointed. Your clothes, chair and tables will hang on the wall. It just works at the Moxy!

I stayed here over the weekend and really enjoyed it. We got to the city early and although there wasn't a room ready, the front desk was able to hold on to our bags so we could start our day. Upon check in we were given 2 drink tokens for their signature drink in the bar. The room was small but it still felt like we had enough space. The bathroom is bigger and bright. The bed was comfortable but if you like pillows, I would request more upon your arrival. The bar are seemed to be a nice hangout and was always full with people. The location of this hotel is great and is safe. Walking distance to Starbucks, WTC and subway. There is also a CVS nearby.

If you value customer service then this hotel might not be for you. I’m a very frequent traveler but patient and some issues I had at this hotel were aggravating. The Rec room games are fun but the waitstaff was not very attentive on multiple nights. The bar staff seemed better. The room was perfect size for 2 of us (my daughter is 7). But the front desk failed to tell me they don’t clean rooms daily. I ordered extra towels over the phone and via the app and they were never delivered. A room near us did not abide by the no smoking rule; they smoked cigarettes and pot all weekend which made our room smell awful. It was fine after they checked out. The last day there was no hot water (beyond the hotels control I was told). At check out I was told I would get 25k points but have not nearly 3 weeks later. Keep your expectations low and you’ll enjoy your stay.

My wife spent 3 night here and really liked it. Fun vibe. Really friendly and helpful staff. Rafael really made us feel special. Rooms aren’t big but they are well appointed. Would definitely stay here again.

review_body: TLDR: The Good: I found it clean. The front desk staff was very polite. John, the engineering on the night shift, is AMAZING and, honestly, saved my opinion of the hotel.The Neutral: The hotel is definitely geared toward a younger crowd. The Bad: The TV and streaming services need work and the WiFi needs to be secure. The hotel is fairly new and the staff seem to need some additional training on the protocols specific to the hotel (like how to get ice). Also, it needs to be much easier to get ice.Longer review:I stayed here for a few days last weekend. I was in town for my best friend's 30th birthday weekend, so we had this whole weekend planned to take the most advantage of our limited time. Check-In: The check-in process was a breeze for me. There was someone else in the lobby who was having issues checking in because of the credit card on file (it was a work trip) and, though he was trying to keep it together, was clearly starting to fray at the edges. The front desk staff didn't falter at all and kept a very pleasant demeanor and tried to fix the problem without adding to the customer's stress.Getting up to the room was tricky (you have to take the elevator in the lobby to the third floor, walk around the edge of the loud and crowded bar/rec area, then take another elevator up to your floor). The room: The room was small, but it's NYC, so that's what I expected. I thought they used the space well. Another reviewer mentioned that there's no iron or board, but I found it in the drawer under the bed.The TV: This was a CHALLENGE. My best friend lives in Canada and he's been waiting to see the new season of the Magicians, which isn't available for streaming in Canada. So, I checked on the hotel website to ensure that I could stream Hulu at the hotel, and it said I could. When I got into my room I could watch Hulu, but I couldn’t use any of the premium features (like Live TV or watch certain shows like the Magicians). I contacted Hulu support and they said it was for one of two reasons: 1. The TV was made before 2016, or 2. The hotel needed to update the Hulu app. And thus, began a many-houred saga of trying to fix this issue.I called down to the front desk. They said that, since the hotel is only around 6 months old, the TV was new, so they would send up an engineer to look at it. The engineer from the night shift (a man named John with the patience of a saint and excellent customer service) came up and, after hearing the issue, informed me that they contract with an outside company for TV software and app maintenance. Long story short, hours later, he had had that company reset and update my TV 3 times with no luck. We tried Chrome Casting to the TV from my laptop, but there was a HUGE lag between the image and the sound. In the end, I just ended up buying the episodes from YouTube and watching it on the YouTube app on the TV, but I shouldn't have had to. I also should not have had to go through the saga to begin with. I know this is a new place and they're still ironing out the kinks, so I'm giving them a bit of a pass on not knowing about this, but I hope they are more aware in the future.The ICE: As John and I spent a while together trying to fix my TV, we chatted. So, he found out I had just had a minor outpatient ortho procedure earlier in the day. He asked if I wanted some ice. I had honestly been so distracted by trying to get things set up for my friend's bday celebration, I hadn't even noticed how much pain I was in, or that there were no ice buckets in the room. I let him know I would go get it from the machine. Apparently, you have to ORDER ice at this hotel. There is not an ice machine on the floor or one accessible to guests. John, again, cannot say enough good things about him, got me some ice and told me that if I needed more tomorrow or later in my stay I should contact the front desk.The next day, I needed more ice. I called the front desk and they told me I needed to go down to the bar, which I did. I then stood there for a while without being helped, despite trying to wave someone down. I guess it was my mistake wearing my PJs down to the bar instead of something more hip *sigh*. I finally got someone's attention and he told me that I needed to call the front desk, which I told him I had, and that they should have sent some up to my room. He got me ice anyway, but, seriously, getting a bag of ice should not be this hard.

We stayed at the Moxy Downtown this past weekend. It was our first experience and there were pro's & con's from our stay. First, the con's: 1. The hotel is located on Ann Street which is very narrow road. The hotel does not have even one designated parking spot in front of the entrance for off-loading your luggage so the choices are to either double park & hold up traffic or drive around the block a few times. 2. You have to take the elevator up to the third floor and then switch to another elevator bank which takes you to your floor. This appears to be set up this way so that you have to walk through the bar & arcade area. It's inconvenient. 3. We were given two tokens when we checked in and were told that each token could be used for a special hotel cocktail at the third floor bar. My wife ordered the special hotel cocktail at the bar and when she presented the token to the bartender, she (the bartender) said the token was only for the smaller version of the drink, not the size she made and that we would have to pay for the drink. I informed her that no one at the front desk told us this and that she should have told us their policy before serving the cocktail. I refused to pay for the drink and the bartender got angry and informed my wife and I that "she doesn't make the rules". I didn't pay for the drink. 4. If you are in the mood for a cocktail that is not on their cocktail menu, it will cost you $21.00!!! 5. They serve coffee but no decaf. 6. They spent a lot of money on fancy furnishings in the rooms and other areas however, we had very poor water pressure in our room which made for a disappointing shower. 7. Even though we were on an upper floor (11), the noise level from the Saturday over night construction activities and garbage pickup was high. 8. There is only one thin pillow provided per person. Now, the Pro's: 1. Great location-only a block from the World Trade Center, Trinity Church & City Hall. 2. Great flat screen TV in our room with a good selection of channels. 3. Our room & the hotel was very clean. 4. The service (except for the bartender) was very good.

Mark S
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here with another couple for a winter weekend in NYC. This hotel was a great spot for us and the hotel bar was a wonderful place to spend the evening after a long day of traveling. Only 4 stars because the check-in process was difficult being the card reader wasn't working properly and the hotel staff is lean to say the least.

Okay so it's a limited service, millenial targeted hotel. As such it does its job very well. Those who gave low reviews for lack of pampering and attention are a bit unfair because it doesn't claim to be a JW Marriott. We are at least 10 years away from passing for millenials but really enjoyed this place. The rooms are well designed, innovative and fun. Certainly minimalist and on the small side consistent with NYC and then some. We had the deluxe king, assumedly the largest room in the place and I would say it was barely 150-160 s.f. including the tiny box bathroom. Not a problem for us but if you are a family or if that bothers you, look elsewhere. The fit and finish of the room was not bad, nice beds and bedding, fun swing (though a tight squeeze if you are tall), good TV and sound, electric blinds, folding chairs, and cork flooring, something I've never seen in a hotel. Lights fairly impossible to figure out, as with many new hotels. HVAC too loud. Bathroom is tight but functional. Bar got loud at times and as noted you do have to traverse it to switch elevators. One elevator was broken while were there, causing annoying delays on the other two. We enjoyed the games and the free signature drink there though and would definitely hang out there more if we were bar people. Breakfast was decent and appreciate the free coffee and interesting herbal teas, though I would suggest that for fourteen bucks they could serve more than one single slice of avocado toast in an order. They gave us the appropriate Marriott status benefits, though limited at Moxy brand. Location is great if you want to be downtown. Staff was friendly and fairly efficient and we experienced none of the checkin or service problems others mentioned. Overall I would say this is a very solid choice, if you are youngish at heart and don't need to be fussed over, don't mind smallish rooms and taking some time to figure out the way things work, and if you can get it for a good price like we did. It is an interesting brand and marketing, and based on the crowds of millenials there, it looks like it is working.

The bar has great music, a fun atmosphere. Robby was quick and attentive-introducing me to my now favorite cocktail The Moxy. James, at the front desk was also efficient and responsive. It's a unique hotel experience.

Location downtown was good. Near Freedom Tower and City Hotel. Check in was a nightmare. Could not get automated check in to work. There was only one person working in tiny lobby and he was trying to deal with some kind of complicated problem. Annoying music was playing. I was standing there waiting for half an hour. You have to take the elevator to the third floor which is a bar taking up the whole floor. Then you take another elevator to your room. The rooms are nice but pod sized. I would not mind staying there again if automated check in were greatly improved and I were paying a pod sized price.

One night in New York and wanted to get decently priced hotel room with easy access to JFK and as Marriott/SPG loyalist, preferably something under Bonvoy umbrella. Moxy had king room with attractive $99 price tag, sold! The hotel is quite invisible on the street level as there is just a sign and a small lobby where you can check in using ipad kiosks or with an agent. Elevator takes you three floor up to the real lobby which was more like a hip and trendy club on this Friday evening. From there up to the 19th floor to my upgraded city view room. The room was small as expected and as typical in New York, but it was extremely sleek and modern with all the basics. Clean and nice bathroom with peeking window to the room, excellent bed and electric blinds. When checking in, I received a chip which I could use for free drink in the lounge. I took their signature drink which was great. Lots of restaurants, bars and shops close by and only five minutes walk to South Street Seaport. I was asking for late check out and got one extra hour which was very useful. I was very happy and would return here in a heart beat!

Before I get to the meh, I have to say that it is a cool hotel. The room was very functional but small, and frankly I like the smallness of the Moxy rooms. The lounge/bar area is great to sit in. The bartenders were exceptionally friendly. The whole hotel is clean, and was good for a weekend stay.However, a few annoyances. First off, once we dropped off the luggage as we arrived before check-in. When we returned, it took almost 10 minutes for the bell to bring the luggage up. Seemed to be understaffed. Because of what I assume was big turnover the night before, our room didn't have the Marriott room preferences like extra pillows. I used the app to request extra pillows. 6 hours later, no extra pillows, but the task was marked "complete." I asked on the app again, and did not receive a reply until after I had checked-out, over 12 hours later asking what they could do. There wasn't really anything since we had checked out.I would definitively stay again if the rate was right, but the service didn't seem up to par from other Moxy properties.

Location is downtown which is awesome for access to a lot. And less touristy than midtown. Hotel is cool and edgy with an awesome great room, bar and all around hangout area that transforms throughout the day from breakfast area to co-working coffee shop to bar and then full on fun in the evening. Rooms are typical of NYC but make the most creative use of space to feel cool. And the floor to ceiling windows help open it all up.

Before I launch off into my review, let me preface this with the following. I am a long-term Marriott business traveler who has used many of their different lines for service. For those of you not aware, the Moxy line of hotels is NOT targeted towards business travelers, but my schedule forced me to book this last minute. It is a line that is targeted for millennials, fun and simplicity. Those of you with 5 star, frequent traveler expectations need not stay here. That goes the same for families. Please curb your expectations if you fall into one of these two categories as your bad reviews are a little undeserved. I get that the price point is phenomenal. But, this is meant to be a high end hostel replacement. It’s a place meant for fun, not a high end stay. With that said, here are my thoughts. The pros: The hotel is clean and conveniently located to what seems like every subway line to get uptown (2 blocks away). The lobby is hip and fun with lots to do and a decent tasty food service. It turns into a club vibe by happy hour complete with a DJ, flashy lighting and fun games. I noticed this place was very clean. It looks like they fixed a lot of the “new hotel” kinks where cleaning wasn’t up to par. Both the public spaces (including restrooms), the hallways and the rooms were clean. I was upgraded to a room with a beautiful view. Now for the room, it’s simple, but works. The bed is very comfortable and the bathroom has cute details such as a window in the shower (yes, you can close it). There is free HBO and access to your online accounts such as Netflix on the TV. The toiletries were nice. I did not use the gym. I did, however, go down to the bar and the bartenders were nice and helpful to everyone (one even gave the group next to me better recommendations to fine tune their bill). The cons: As mentioned, this isn’t the best hotel for business travelers or families. I noticed a few kids. Don’t bring them here. The downstairs is not appropriate for them, even with the skeeball. It’s basically a club. Working downstairs is great, until Happy Hour when the beat gets pumping. The room has no dresser or closet. KNOW THAT! You will be keeping all your belongings in your suitcase. Not a huge issue as I was done with meetings. But, some may hate it. They provide 2 hangers that attach to the wall. So, you do have a spot for your coat. While the swing is cool, there is just one other foldable chair provided which no one above 120lbs will be able to use. They do not provide lotion. So, bring some. Now for the worst part. The headboard has these attached lamps for reading, night light etc. They are horrible! They are situated so that you will konk your head on them when you sit up. Trust me. You will also smack your face into them when you reach to get your phone if you are trying to charge using the outlets next to the bed. There is no nightstand. So, you’re forced to lay it on the swing or the floor. Floor = hit your head/face. I suffered this injury, unfortunately. I have now tried to file an incident report twice, which leads me to the staff. They have staffed this place with millennials with no attention to customer service. Are they hip and cool looking? Yes. Do they want to HELP you? Depends on when they are done looking at their phone. The front desk is a small stand at the entrance with young individuals. Check-in was painless, but check-out was a melee with two “workers” unprepared to service both incoming and outgoing at once. I called to file an incident report and even then, no one really wanted to help me with the poor front desk guy admitting “I have no clue how to even service a complaint.” After a bit of a hold, the Director did not even want to hear the details of my complaint. She cut me off with the “please email me” response. In conclusion, my stay was fine and I managed to keep my expectations in check knowing who this line is targeting. However, I feel the need to call them out on their customer service. Being hip does not mean you have to forget you are still a Marriott and that customer service is important, no matter who the guest may be.

My girlfriend and I stayed here one night when we visited a friend in NYC and we had a blast. We found the Moxy through Booking or Priceline but either way, it was great! Very cool place; they give you a token for a free drink when you check in, it's their signature cocktail which was pretty good. The level where the bar is also has a game area and a lounge area with tables and couches. There's also a basketball court that can double as a meeting room which i thought was awesome. The room was very cool and very nice. It is small, so if you want a big room, ask for bigger rooms but we didn't mind. Views from the hotel are awesome too. I definitely recommend staying here! The price was great, service was friendly and it's an awesome location; right next to the fulton center subway station.

Last year we stayed at Moxy Times Square and absolutely loved it. We had reservations for the Chelsea location but construction was delayed so we switched our reservation to this location. I had some hesitation about staying downtown but it was a great location. It’s only a block away from the Fulton Street station and two blocks from the Freedom Tower. CVS and Starbucks are right around the corner. There’s a Zara at the end of the block. Banks are close as is the Apple Gourmet deli which has great breakfast sandwiches. If you’re easily creeped out by the city you might feel a little unsafe but I’m a native New Yorker and I felt fine walking the streets at night with my friends. Not a sketchy or unsafe area. You also have Aloft hotel one block over and many bars and restaurants within walking distance. We took Lyft to Morton’s Steahouse because it wa Restaurant Wee. The food is incredible but the service horrendous. Our room was a decent size. It’s what I expect every year we visit the city. I love the concept of pegs on the wall and minimal furniture. If you open the drawer under the bed you’ll find an iron and foldable ironing board. There’s a robe in the room as well. There’s only one pillow so request more right away If that’s a problem for you. Housekeeping service may be slow when you call down. Bring your streaming device if you want to watch your shows or simply sign in on the tv and you have the option to erase your private data before you check out. The entry to the hotel is nothing spectacular unfortunately. The Times Square location is more impressive. But the staff are very friendly and welcoming and helpful. You go up the elevator to the third floor then go right and make a left to go to the next set of elevators that take you to your room. Very simple but I know some may complain. The basketball court is so cool and was well used by our husbands. The bar Recreation is a cool concept but during our stay there very boring and quiet. Even the DJ didn’t play great music to encourage dancing. That was disappointing. We got a free drink token and had the signature drink. It had some grapefruit flavor. It wasn’t bad at all. Don’t come to this hotel expecting your typical Marriott stay. It doesn’t have room service, closets, free breakfast, etc. but it was more than sufficient for us to stay and have a great time. Beds are comfy and view was great. I would return.

This is a horrendous hotel - service is awful (they don’t answer the phone ever, they don’t have any amenities in the room so we Called down for an iron - 30 minutes later and 1 trip down to the front desk the iron still isn’t here (need to iron shirt for dinner and now cannot do that) I am a tiranium Marriott customer and can attest that this is the worst Marriott hotel stay I’ve ever had. I think this hotel is run by hipsters who care more about ‘awesome vibes’ than they do about actually providing a proper service. Don’t waste money or points staying at this hotel

If you're looking for another boring typical chain-type hotel, this place might not be for you. If want an authentic artsy Manhattan "get with the times" experience, then I highly recommend this trendy little place. My first impression to be honest was "what in the world did I get myself into?" . A rotary phone?? No table and chairs in the room? These weird hangers? But then when I noticed the switches near the bed that control different styles of lighting and an automatic window shade - not to mention that the old fashioned rotary phone was really push buttons (with a button in the middle that says "Bedtime Stories") did things start to change. The table and chairs fold out of the wall and blend in with the decor. If you are the type that pays attention to these things then the charming details of the bar and lounge area won't be lost on you. Everything was clean and comfortable and I highly recommend trying this place if you're up for something different.

I generally stay in the Aloft or Duane Street when I come for court hearings, but this had a great rate and was brand new, so I thought I’d try. I wasn’t disappointed — for one person, it’s fun, quirky, comfy, just what i needed. It’s not luxury, but it gets the job done and I’ll definitely be back.

Thought I’d check out a new hotel experience with the Moxy. What a disappointment. Tiny room. Bad tv reception. Non-existent amenities—is shampoo too much to ask? Body lotion at the driest, coldest time of year? A shower that floods the entire bathroom. Misrepresentation of the perks—a drink token that was said to grant me a latte in the morning. Only to be denied by the staff then. Some customer service! I’d give this place a pass.

The Moxy downtown in lower Manhattan is situated on a pipe belching, dumpster-laden alley. Inside there are friendly clerks in a tiny vestibule who direct you to the 3rd floor elevator- in which there is a restaurant bar, dj at night, basketball and pink pong.Then you take another elevator to your room. We reserved a room with 2 queen-sized beds. It was so small we had to open the shade to create the illusion of space. There was no hanging chair as seen in their professional photos. There were two beds and a nightstand. A folding table and stools were hanging on a black metal bar bolted to a wood panel wall with a tv. This is an over-priced stylish dorm without a desk, closet, refrigerator. No maid or room service either.

Booked this room online using AAA discount, and to get the discounted rate they required full payment in advance. When a family emergency came up, they refused to refund the cost. Staff was outright rude. There are lots of places to stay in NYC- spend your money elsewhere!

I Booked this hotel for 2 nights while my girlfriend was visiting me in America.I arrived on Friday to a basic arrival (considering I’m a gold member) two free drink tokens and that was it, no complimentary upgrade offered or free points etc. Arrived in the room to a piece of the ceiling hanging on by wires.. wasn’t a big issue just didn’t look great.. the door is also awkward, works on a sensor but takes a good 10 seconds to close. The room was small but cosy.. no wardrobes and only one small draw which housed the safe etc, which also didn’t work. The room and fittings though were nice.. good sound system and a good view.I would stay again but I was just disappointed about the way I was treat when I arrived.

The Moxy NYC downtown is brandnew, modern and stylish. Rooms are simple and clean, however a bit small. The fitness room is cool and well equipped. The hotel is well located in walking distance to Wall Street, with the subway just around the corner. Can highly recommend this hotel for the undemanding business travel. I enjoyed the modern cleanliness.

It is a pleasure to recommend this hotel. Out of the way but close to lower manhattan. Walking distance to WTC Memorial. Rooms are compact design but extremely modern and clean. Food and drinks at the lobby bar were amazing. Highly recommend

The appeal of this hotel is outside the rooms. There is a very lively bar scene on the second floor and also on the roof. Avoid anything above the 14th floor if you don't like the thump thump from the music until all hours. The Moxy's rooms are very minimalist and this is not a good hotel if you ever plan to work in your room. There is an uncomfortable folding chair and small round table to use in a pinch but it's not how you'd want to spend your day working. The rooms with end-to-end beds do not have such"amenities". Location is fine and I had no issues with street noise and the roof bar was only faintly audible on the 14th floor .

Everything is perfect there, location, nice rooms, cleanliness and so on. But what makes this hotel such an amazing place is the excellent staff! Especially Mike! From the moment we arrived with our car and he opened our doors and helped us with luggage he was there for us anytime and guided us through our stay! I've travelled to the big apple a couple of times but this time was special - thanks to him! He knows the hotel and the city like no one else, I've met! All his recommendations were the perfect fit for us. He is super helpful, friendly and very professional! He was very generous with his time and answered all our questions patiently and always with a smile! He definitely deserves a promotion!! But also the other staff, like Maria Alejandra were great and an absolute delight! I'd definitely book this hotel again and I hope they keep the same staff until then!! This hotel performs perfectly even though they've just opened their doors. I highly, highly recommend this place!!!

Branded new hotel with great atmosphere just a few steps from Brooklin bridge (you can see it well from higher floors) and different MTA stations/lines. Very young and trendy staff need some more training but no big issue. Very fast check-in/out. Confy bed, Little but well organized bathroom with large showerMissing (and necessary in winter) an additional duvet.Will go back!

The Moxy, Marriott's minimalist hipster affiliate, does not offer enough for my one night stay with a $425 charge. From the Moxy Advertisement that pops up on the TV at blasting volume when turned on, it seems the Moxy is being offered as a place to LET LOOSE!, BE CRAZY!, PARTY! Sounds like they are asking for the rooms to get trashed. Maybe that's why the rooms look like they are decorated on a budget. In the trend of Ian Schrager hotels, the room has a very small footprint with hyper-stylized but poorly functioning or ill considered furnishings. The bed is comfortable enough, but the clearance between the foot of the bed and the wall is about 1.5 feet. In this space, against the wall is a folding table. This table is essentially useless. You can't sit at it, it's hard to eat off of, if it's down you can't get past the bed. I tried to iron a shirt, but could not find a board or iron. The front desk informed me that it's tucked under the bed. Unfolded, the ironing board fits nowhere in the room where it's possible to easily iron something, certainly not on the fold out table. I was also puzzled by some wooden objects hanging on the same wall which turned out to be folded stools. Didn't bother trying to sit on one, as there was little space to put it. There is no closet, not dresser or any type of drawer for clothes, oh, and no hangers, only hooks on the wall. There is one mod iron basket like chair hanging on a chain next to the bed. Not comfortable, but maybe the designers thought creative people could use it as a sling, I mean a swing?There is also no room service and no restaurant in the hotel. There is a large 3rd floor space called, RECREATION, where you can play chess, skee ball, get a drink at the bar, or sit and ignore people while you work on your laptop. When enter the hotel, you are going to ask where you check in. It's that little desk to the right where one or two dispassionate staff might be stationed. If you don't want to deal with them, you can do the work and check yourself in at the little computer pads against the window. The most remarkable thing in the 'lobby' is a giant video screen over the elevators that you have to crane your neck up to see, meaning, you can't back up far for a better view, the 'lobby' is very narrow.There are some newish technology features in the room, like recessed LED lighting, an electronic shade, and a bluetooth capable TV, but there is also no ON DEMAND service on the TV. The bathroom is fine.Look, if you are a tourist and plan on spending minimal time in the room, I suppose it's fine. If you are planning on hanging out in the room, I'd suggest somewhere that offers furnishings less reminiscent of IKEA.

We loved this hotel! The downtown area has become much cooler and is close to Brooklyn and East Village (my fave areas for food and drinks). This property is GREAT! The lobby area is unreal - a huge bar area with games and a place to hang out. The room was quiet and super comfortable, big comfy bed, a nice bathroom, we had a swing seat in ours. They make great use of the space.

We had three rooms (all very similar) in this new build downtown. The rooms are great - it feels like the team behind the hotel have really thought through what people need and want and found a way to deliver it even in a small space. The public area is where the hotel shines - a combination basketball court/bar/shared space that sounds like it wouldn't work but absolutely does. Add to this a surprisingly energetic late-night crowd and excellent breakfast and drink options and we had a hit for adults and children. Would definitely return.

Our stay started at the front desk where we were greeted by Maria and Sydney. After offering us some hot chocolate, they got our 3 rooms all sorted out and escorted us up to the 3rd floor lobby. Wow!! Of all the hotels I have stayed at ( and I have stayed at a lot of hotels)This was by far the funkiest, and coolest place . From a Half Basketball court in a private room off the lobby to a washroom where you can see the outside but they can't see you, to a bar, DJ, And many more features.Our room was small but had everything we needed and set up in a very creative way. Everyone we encountered that worked at this hotel was very friendly, helpful and caring.We absolutely loved our stay and were disappointed we couldn't stay longer.A special thanks to Maria and Sydney for recommending a great breakfast spot and places of interest to see! This hotel is very well run.

Very happy with this hotel. It was nice to be away from busy midtown but able to easily access it since the train was near the hotel. Hip vibe. The staff was very friendly and the cocktails were very good. We were able to relax, eat and enjoy our cocktails while our kids played skee ball, board games, basketball, and foosball. We also enjoyed the games. Everything was clean and modern. We had a beautiful view also. Would definitely return.

Didn’t expect free skiball and a DJ in the restaurant/bar and also small basketball court, ping pong etc. The restaurant has great avocado toast and cocktails and it’s lots of fun. Definitely for young at heart traveler with self check in, no room service. The fun atmosphere makes up for no frills.

Spending the weekend in the City as a Christmas "present" for my wife and I, and we decided to stay in a different area of Manhattan. When we checked in the lobby looked very unassuming, but we soon realized that this hotel is vastly different than anything we've stayed at before. It had a much more "Millennial" vibe. There were kiosk to check-in and even a virtual key you could use through your Marriott app. The bar was really cool with Ski-ball, shuffleboard, and a great lounge area. The room was one of the coolest we've probably stayed in. The only downsides were the amount of storage space is very small, but for our weekend stay it wasn't a problem. And the water pressure was a little lacking, other than that we really enjoyed our stay. My only advise would be to do a little research before you book. Some of the other bad reviews may put you off, but if this kind of experience is what you're looking for I would definitely recommend the Moxy.

This place does not even deserve a star. I am a Platinum member who have stayed in a number of SPG/Marriott properties and this is the worst. 1. I stayed for 4 nights and the room was never cleaned. NEVER - despite me calling them to ask them why there was no housekeeping on the 2nd, 3rd night.2. I asked for late checkout and was given late checkout at 5.30pm (There was a 5th night free deal but I do not need that and instead asked for early evening checkout). However, on the day that I was suppose to check out, the reception started calling my room at 4+pm, almost every 10 to 15mins and sending people to knock my room door. She was really rude and almost yelling at me. At 5pm, she called again, yelling at me ''you have to get out of the room". While all these is happening, I was trying to finish packing my luggage. If she did not keep calling me, I could have vacate the room earlier but she simply wouldn't listen.3. I understand this is a budget range SPG/Marriott hotel but still proceed to use my upgrade nights so that I can get a room with a view. However, there was no view. I was not even put on a higher floor. Even the view from where the lifts were is better than the one from my room. ''Awesome upgrade"Wanted to try this hotel because it is new with a cool concept. But no thanks if I have to be insulted by the staff and not having my room cleaned at all.

Maybe ok if you are a millennial, I don’t know. Not ok if you want someplace comfortable to stay. My husband and I wanted a night off from kids, stress, etc. this place was not it. Bed was rock hard, no customer service, no quiet place to have a drink. Finally we got up at 5 and got out. For someplace that tries really hard to be sexy maybe they should take a class in what sexy is. I normally would try to forget this place and wouldn’t waste my time with a review but wanted to save someone else (and their back)

I was booked at a neighbouring hotel that could no longer accommodate my reservation so they moved me to this hotel. The hotel is in walking distance to the WTC. My expectations were low as I considered this brand to be subpar but I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are small but it’s New York and they were very well appointed. The staff was extremely friendly and the bar area on the third floor had a great ambiance. Kudos to this hotel for exceeding expectations.

i came to NYC with my dad to see basketball games at MSG and barclays and booked the moxy with no prior knowledge of the place. i was MORE than happy. the check in staff was wonderful and friendly (and not teenagers, based on the other review) the room was clean and had cute signs/messages all over, which i loved. e.g. “slippery when wet” in the shower, “bottoms up” on the glasses... and the mattress was sooo comfortable. and i loved the neon room number signs in the hallway. they also had a smart tv so i could sign into my accounts and watch netflix or play pandora, etc. also, i spent time at the bar downstairs that had a great drink selection, excellent food, and skee-ball! also i loved the bar crew... garrett, robby, carissa, and especially carly, were the nicest during my 4 nights there. the last time i was in new york i had a bad time, but this trip more than made up for it, mostly because of the moxy. i’m already trying to convince my husband to take a NYC trip with me next year.

I almost changed my reservations based on earlier negative TI reviews. So glad I didn't! I stayed for 2 nights with my 2 adult daughters and we had a great stay. Check in was fast, efficient, professional and friendly. We never had to open the door once during our entire stay.. the doorman was always there and ready... even provided each of us umbrellas to use for the day. The lobby is a really fun, cool space. Quieter in the early day/evening then very lively with music/DJ late night. Noise was not an issue for our room at all. I thought the room layout was very well done. Some really unique and well thought design elements. Good shower, super comfortable beds! Fantastic location as well. Very close to World Trade and just a quick jump to Brooklyn. Check it out!

I'm not a millennial by my stay at the Moxy NYC Downtown was a fun one! It's a newer property that recently opened and the crew is still working out some of the kinks. However, the Moxy crew members are nice, attentive, and focused on creating a great guest experience. I traveled to NYC with my wife and two millenial daughters. My daughters loved the "vibe" -- their words, not mine. We spent a lot of time hanging out in Recreation while we planned our adventures.

I honestly was a little worried about staying at the Moxy Downtown since the reviews were mixed. I was surprised when I got there. Positively surprised. The employees were very attentive. They checked us in, and immediately showed us the lobby and all its amenities. The room was very clean, and was nice overall. I did not have to ask for anything extra. There was even a safe. I really do not have anything bad to say about the hotel. For the price, it was an excellent bargain.

I stayed at the Moxy last weekend when I was in NYC for a conference. It was the cheapest I could get with my Starwood points, and happened to relatively close to the subway I needed for my conference in Brooklyn (I wound up taking a Lyft, but that was fine, too, since the Moxy is far enough downtown that it made crossing to Brooklyn relatively painless). My spouse and I are SPG Gold, but we were placed in a room on the 7th floor, meaning they didn't seem to care about our status (first world problems, I know, but what's the point of having status if it's not going to be honored?). My spouse checked in before me, and he let me know via text that teenagers were running the front desk. When I arrived several hours later, I found that to be accurate. Picking up a key from the front desk after my spouse left my name and his room number wasn't an ordeal, but was definitely not the seamless process it would have been at other SPG hotels. (I don't have a ton of experience with Marriott, so maybe it would have been.)The room itself was fine, very minimalist with hooks instead of closets, no safe, etc. The shade in our room was broken, but we told someone about it the next day, and they sort of fixed it--instead of not being able to go down at all, it went down all the way but only came up half way. When I walked into the bathroom, I knew the Moxy was made with white Millennials in mind--there is no lotion. I've stayed at the Aloft and other "no frills" hotels, but there's always lotion. Ask any person of color (especially an African-American), and I guarantee you they will say they use lotion every day. This hotel had none, which means they were not thinking about people of color when they created it. Luckily, I bring my own, but it would have been really annoying to have had to go buy some because my hotel was only thinking of white people when they created it. The gym was minimalist, but fine, with some weights and nice, new treadmills and ellipticals, and fitness bands. There's some floor space, so as long as it's not crowded, you can do floor work fairly easily. And there's wipes to sanitize the equipment after you use it, but no trashcan. And there are towels, but no bin for used towels... No frills is one thing, but these things just seemed to be lack of attention to detail. There is a bathroom, so you can throw things away there, but it's unmarked, just a random door, which I didn't know was a bathroom until a worker went in and came out. Oh, and the elevators kept going out. My best guess is someone, maybe a cleaning person, would hold elevator around the 8th floor, thereby sticking it so no one else could use it. There are three elevators for ~30 floors, so each one is needed. Also, when you arrive on the 3rd floor bar/lobby, you'll see a sign to the right that says "Rooms" with an arrow pointing to the right. Go in the opposite direction to get to the elevators. In daylight, you'll see that on the other side of that "Rooms" sign is the word "Rest." I and so many others made the mistake of walking around the floor, only to find the elevators in the opposite direction. For the love of God, Moxy, please change that.Driving home the white Millennial thing, the decor in the bar area is very 80s nostalgic, and the music on weekend nights corresponds, reminding these white 30somethings of their childhood. Lotion aside, I am a Black Millennial who felt pretty out of place as a result, so I'm not inclined to stay at the Moxy again. But I'm sure my white friends would love it, so I'll recommend it to them.

review_body: The Moxy is a cool concept; the lobby bar/lounge is really good-looking, and is a nice way to escape your hotel room. However, there were issues with the elevators from the lobby to the guest floors; on a Sunday morning, only one out of three were working. The wait was lengthy, over 10 minutes. More importantly though, this is not a good choice for those who value Marriott Rewards benefits. As a Platinum member, I can overlook a lot of things, but I cherish the 4 PM Guaranteed late checkout. The staff refused to allow it, even when I politely reminded her that it is "guaranteed." If you don't want to stick to basic service guarantees, you should just abandon the brand. I'll echo the complaints about construction- it was noisy, and persistent. Eventually that'll be finished, I imagine.

This hotel tries way too hard to be a “hip” destination, but they can’t get the basics down. It’s also clear that it’s not ready yet for visitors (though it opened earlier this year). Maybe in about 6 months, with a change of management, you might consider it—if you care more about the bar scene than a pleasant stay. On the first of my 5 nights here, I was awoken at 5:45am to knocking. At first I thought it was someone knocking on a door but after it didn't stop for 20 minutes I got dressed and started walking around the hotel to try to find the source.I'm on the 7th floor and went up to the 8th floor, didn't see anyone, so then went down to the 6th floor. Here I encountered one of their employees wandering the hallways trying to find the source as well. Apparently at least a few other guests had complained.This employee told me that they had construction going on many floors up (20th or something?) and that he thought there could be no way the sound was traveling that far. Well, it was, and it must have woken loads of other guests.Besides construction in the middle of the night, they haven’t bothered to clean my room for the past 2 days—even after I double checked my do not disturb sign was NOT on and asked the front desk personnel to clean it on my way out the other afternoon. Where they wrote my room number down, I don’t know, but it never made it to housekeeping. As to the bar, it seems they’re more interested in throwing events here than serving their hotel guests. On Tuesday night they had some Bumble event and actually shut the bar down so no hotel guests could order drinks or food (we tried). On Wednesday or Thursday—can’t remember which—they had some NYU alum event that took over the entire bar. There’s no quiet place to do work at all, and the rooms don’t have an adequate guest chair, so if you’re here for work you’re out of luck. The elevator today (Saturday) was full of discarded construction equipment and wires plugged in that lead nowhere. Took a picture of some of it. Anyway, avoid this place if you can. Note that I also reported the above to Marriott Rewards (I’m doing their Platinum Elite challenge right now) and was told they had spoken to the hotel on Monday and they’d be reaching out to me but it’s Saturday, I just checked out of my dirty room, and haven’t heard a thing.

As a Marriott platinum Premier member, I stay at hotels very frequently for both work and pleasure. I am loyal to the Marriott brand because my status is typically recognized and because of the high quality of hotels and service in the brand. I was excited to stay at the Moxy since I heard it was new and a little bit fun and funky. However, the stay thus far has been dysfunctional and a bit irritating. I’m here for one more night and won’t be returning. Few things to call out:Service and helpfulness - When I checked in, there were 4 employees, yet it seemed to take all 4 of them to check in my stay. Nothing about my status was mentioned, nor any amenities of the hotel. Ok.....turned to the elevator and saw there were floors 1,2,3. I noticed that I was on the 13th floor. Would have been nice if somebody to at least mentioned what floor I need to go to in order to find the next set of elevators. Instead, nothing. Nothing about breakfast, meal recommendations, etc. Later that day I asked for a razor. Front desk employee didn’t know where they were and wasn’t sure if they have them. Turns out they did but not until after I already went and purchased one because I didn’t want to make multiple trips and wait for the front desk employee to verify. Called downstairs a little later, but no answer. Seems the phones aren’t being managed. Asked about printing something-apparently the hotel is not setup for printing? Lastly, its almost 4 and my room hasn’t been serviced?Room-I get it in New York hotel rooms are going to be small. But this hotel room is a little bit absurd and there is no chair or no luggage rack. Bathroom is ok surprisingly but no separate fan from light. So it’s quite loud.Not a fan, at all.

Stayed at The Moxy last night and had a pretty good experience. The staff was great - very nice and welcoming throughout the stay. From the greeting at check-in to the wait/bar staff in the evening to the breakfast staff the next morning, everyone was super nice and eager to help. Free coffee in the morning was a great plus as well. The property is new (literally just opened) and is still working out some of the kinks. The decor and set up is a bit quirky and hipsterish, but generally works. Room was very small, even by NY standards, but very clean and well put together. There’s no closet (but there are hangers in the room for clothes) and the desk is a fold-away table, but it’s all pretty functional and works just fine. Location is great - right in the middle of downtown and minutes from WTC, multiple subway stops, and lots of restaurants and shopping. Overall a good stay. Will definitely be back.

I stayed at the Moxy NYC Downtown for three nights.Check-in was a breeze. The front desk clerks was friendly and accommodated my request for an early check-in. They also recognized my Elite Marriott Status and provided us with two free drinks vouchers.Hotel is conveniently located in a quiet area, close to numerous subway lines.Our room on the 17th floor was small but efficient. Bed was comfortable.The window blinds and lights worked off an automatic control button next to the bed.Window opens a crack, which was nice.Bathroom size was adequate, but no water pressure in the shower. It took over 15 minutes for the water to get warm/hot. We never ran out of hot water, it just took for ever to get it! With the hotel being new, we appreciated new, soft towels….On the second day, we returned around 9 pm after being out all day to note our room was not made up. When I called the front desk, I was advised they don’t service rooms daily unless you request it. When you’re paying high rates you would expect your room cleaned daily. I wanted to ask the manager if this was the case with all Moxy Hotels, but I forgot.My husband didn’t like the hotel, he thought it was like a college dormitory.I’m on the fence about the Moxy but would return if the price was right!Our Uber ride cost fifty dollars each way. From LGA to the hotel on a Saturday at 1 pm took 35 minutes. Return trip to LGA on a weekday at 4:30 am took 20 minutes.

Thank you to Yakima and the Moxy team!!! My wife is running the NYC Marathon and Yakima and team arranged the perfect power breakfast and motivation. The hotel is beautiful with a fun happening 3rd floor bar/game floor. We will be back.

review_body: This is a new, high energy beautiful, trendy boutique hotel from the Marriott Portfolio. The Moxy has a great vibe. The location is very low key with tons of food, shopping and fun right outside the door.Check in was a breeze! Got up to the 3rd floor where I was greeted with fun... adult style. I played skee ball, basketball and ping pong while enjoying the Moxy cocktail and some delicious small bites. A DJ is also available.The room is very cozy and just the right amount of space. The swinging chair (glad it’s bolted) is very comfortable and relaxing to sit in. The bed is comfortable also. Definitely loving Moxy. If you want to get in touch with your inner child, I recommend this property. I will definitely be back and am excited to visit other Moxy properties.
